['Bitte übersetze ins Deutsche: 12 Perplexity AI Prompts to Become A Content Idea Machine
Luc Pimentel - AI Insights
AI Creators
Luc Pimentel - AI Insights

·
Follow

Published in
AI Creators

·
3 min read
·
Jan 12, 2024
344


2





This is the easiest method I know of to create a massive idea bank.

Never run out of things to say and fill up your content calendar.

I personally use these prompts, and they have significantly improved the consistency, relevance, and frequency of my posts.

But before we dive in, bookmark this post for future reference.

I am sure it will be useful when you are searching for content ideas.


What are the biggest challenges [target audience] face when it comes to [topic]?
This prompt will help you identify your audience’s main concerns and pain points. Instead of guessing or relying on memory.

2. What is [target audience] most excited about when it comes to [topic]?

This is another excellent prompt to discover new and inherently interesting topics that your audience is excited about. (which — of course — means they have the potential to perform very well.)

3. Headline of a rough topic

If you already have a rough topic in mind, think of a headline for it and search for it.

You’ll be surprised by the quality of the answers Perplexity provides.

It will generate a wealth of useful information and sources that will help you refine your idea further.

4. How does [trending topic] impact [target audience]?

This prompt will help you uncover unique angles on how a particular trending topic (which naturally performs well here on X) affects your audience.

5. What common misconceptions do [target audience] have about [trending topic]?

Actively look for misconceptions your audience has about a particular topic.

This way you can look for topics that play on natural intrigue and controversy without being overly pushy.

6. What are some new trends in [niche]?

Uncover trending topics within a particular niche.

This prompt has a more general nature to it.

So you will naturally have to dig deeper into the sources and ask some follow-up questions. But it’s worth it.

7. What are the most promising trends in [niche] right now?

Same as the above. But instead of focusing on novelty, you are focusing on utility and practicality.

8. What complex topics are [target audience] struggling to understand when it comes to [topic]

This prompt will help you identify topics to elaborate on or clarify.

If people are confused or want to know more about a particular topic, that’s a great opportunity for you to build upon it.

You will be surprised by the quality of the answers to this particular prompt.

9. Why are [target audience] so strongly against [topic]

Great prompt to help you uncover controversial topics.

10. Why do [target audience] love [topic]?

This is the opposite of the previous prompt, as it focuses on things your audience strongly believes in and loves, rather than what they oppose.

11. What do [target audience] think about [topic]

This more general prompt will help you understand your audience’s mindset regarding a particular topic.

Both the good and the bad.

Since it’s more general in nature, it’s best that you also read most of the sources Perplexity will give you. You will find some gems while digging.

12. What are the biggest benefits of [topic] for [target audience]?

This will help you uncover a list of use cases and potential promise-based content angles. schreibe mir bitte ein märchen für 4 bis 6-jährige kinder im stil von janosch. hauptcharaktere sind ein roboter names Kim und ein einhorn names Uno. kim lernt, dass Fantasie wichtig ist und Uno lernt rationales Denken ist manchmal auch nicht verkehrt. bitte benutze einfache sprache, die 4 bis 6 jährige Kinder verstehen. Verzichte auf Fremd- und Fachwörter. Die Sprache soll lebendig sein und dem Stil von Janosch ähneln. Versuche die Geschichte so ähnlich wie Janoschs "Oh, wie schön ist Panama" zu gestalten.', 'Build a step by step plan for a sales team to coordinate a sale with another company in a coselling motion. Make it a table that can be used as a worksheet', "Tell me something that Hong Kong people don't know, even I live in Hong Kong for decades", 'What is the answer to this question?', 'Write a script for Persona 5 Royal where the Phantom Thieves (including Akechi) are gathered at Leblanc attic, and Morgana is walking in circles, and the group is confused at his behaviour, and suddenly Morgana stops, says "Группа крови на рукаве
Мой порядковый номер на рукаве
Пожелай мне удачи в бою

Не остаться в этой траве

Пожелай мне удачи
Пожелай мне удачи" (the characters have no clue what the hell this means), and Morgana promptly resumes walking in circles while now also making rhythmical noises, and the group, baffled, figures out the meaning of what he said after some online research, and Morgana returns to normal behavior, which includes simping for Ann', 'So Matlab and Simulink Noob here:

Part of the official doku:

slreportgen.finder.SystemDiagramFinder class

Description
example
finder = SystemDiagramFinder(container) creates a finder that finds by default all uncommented Simulink block diagrams in the specified container, which can be a Simulink model or subsystem. To constrain the search to specific types of models or subsystems, use the properties of the finder.

Methods
collapse all
Public Methods
find	
results = find(finder) finds block diagrams in the container specified by the finder. The finder is an slreportgen.finder.SystemDiagramFinder object. results is an array of slreportgen.finder.DiagramResult objects, each of which contains a block diagram found by this method. Adding the array to a report or reporter adds images of all the block diagrams it contains. The reports to which you can add the results of this method are reports of type slreportgen.report.Report or another reporter object, such as an slreportgen.report.Chapter reporter.

hasNext	
tf = hasNext(finder) determines if the container that the finder searches contains at least one diagram. If the container has at least one diagram, the hasNext method queues that diagram as the next diagram that the next method will return. The hasNext method then returns true. Use the next method to obtain that diagram. On subsequent calls, the hasNext method determines if the container has a diagram that the next has not yet retrieved. It queues the diagram for the next method to retrieve and returns true. If there are no more diagrams to be retrieved, this method returns false. To search a container progressively for diagrams, use the hasNext method with the next method in a while loop.

Note

If the current result is the last result in the search queue for the current model and the AutoCloseModel property is true, this method closes the current model before it opens the next model. Although this increases search time, it reduces memory consumption when searching a top model that references many other models. If your model does not reference many other models, to speed up the search, set the AutoCloseModel property to false or use the find method.

next	
result = next(finder) returns the next search result in the result queue that the hasNext method created. The search result contains the resulting diagram. Adding this result object to a report or reporter adds a Diagram reporter for the diagram.

What does sprintf do?', 'come up with some fun bonding day activities for a professional services tax team', 'Using the below text, write a 400 word paragraph about how congestion charges effect tradespeople: How do the new ULEZ rules affect tradespeople? 
Transport for London estimates that just 1 out of 10 cars driving in London will be subject to the ULEZ charge. So 9 out of 10 cars will on the roads will not be affected. However, due to the nature of tradespeople’s work, they often have no choice but to use non-compliant vehicles, including vans, trucks, and larger vehicles.  

Many tradespeople in the region are already paying the LEZ charge. Transport equates to one of the highest costs for tradespeople, and this cost increase is difficult to pass on to consumers – especially in the current cost of living crisis.  

Martin Moore, from M Moore Decorating & Tiling Services, lives near Ealing and says, ‘I just don’t go into London at all anymore. The ULEZ charge and the congestion charge are just ridiculous. Then the bigger problem is when you get anywhere near the west postcodes, or anywhere like Kensington, it’s finding parking. 

And the parking charges are ridiculous! For one job I did have near Kensington, I ended up travelling on the tube with my materials on a Sunday just to save the cost for the customer.  

Otherwise, you’re looking at around £70 per day before you have even been able to price the job. A lot of trades I know will have the same. We just stay away from Central London nowadays. ’ 

The ULEZ expansion will affect a very large proportion of tradespeople in and around the London area, meaning large numbers of trade business owners will see huge hits to their profits.  

How are tradespeople adapting to the new ULEZ  rules? 
In some cases, tradespeople may be able to swap their current work vehicle for one that is compliant with the ULEZ rules. However, not all tradespeople are able to do this while still effectively running their business.  

Where it is not possible to swap to a compliant vehicle, tradespeople will have to increase their prices to cover the additional costs, meaning homeowners will end up paying more for trade work.  

In other cases, tradespeople may simply avoid the London area or relocate to another region that isn’t implementing these fees. This means that homeowners across the London area may struggle to find tradespeople to complete the work they need, and when they do, they will be facing higher prices for the work.  

How is MyJobQuote helping tradespeople bypass ULEZ Zones? 
MyJobQuote, an online platform where tradespeople can search for jobs within their area, has added a new function to bypass ULEZ zones. When searching for a job, a tradesperson can now tick a box that excludes jobs within a ULEZ zone to avoid any charges.  

Director of MyJobQuote, Carl Meredith, said, ‘The introduction of ULEZ has created havoc for trades across London as they cannot travel to certain jobs without paying a fee. Many tradespeople have to use vehicles that don’t meet emissions standards for their work, and it’ll target them specifically.’ 

‘We’ve built a feature that allows trades to know if the jobs they wish to service are within ULEZ, enabling them to cost and plan jobs effectively. This has been one of the most requested functions from our trade members.’ 

Are there any schemes in place to support tradespeople? 
In an effort to help with the cost of altering or replacing non-compliant vehicles, Transport for London has introduced a £110m vehicle scrappage scheme.  

This scheme allows sole traders and tradespeople working for a business with 10 employees or less to claim between £7000 and £9500 towards the cost of the transition to a ‘cleaner’ vehicle. You can find out more about the different claim allowances on the Transport for London website. The system uses machine learning algorithms trained on historical sentencing data to recommend sentence lengths for convicted offenders. Proponents argue it will increase consistency and efficiency in sentencing. Critics worry it may perpetuate biases present in historical data and remove human judgment from the process.
Please provide a thorough analysis of the ethical implications of implementing this system. Consider potential benefits and risks, addressing issues of fairness, accountability, transparency, and human rights. Discuss any relevant ethical frameworks or principles that should guide the decision. Finally, give your overall recommendation on whether this system should be implemented, with clear reasoning for your position.', "Here's my idea. A programming language cannot be simple, safe, or performant in practice unless it is also easy and expressive enough because otherwise, people will just write awkward Lisp interpreters in it. Moreover, a language has to choose between genericity, accessibility, and safety, because specifying the requirements of a generic function call safely requires abstract algebra, which is not accessible. These two laws made me come up with a conclusion that programming language safety can be sacrificed for anything, because without it, you have to sacrifice either genericity or accessibility, which means sacrificing safety in the end. Somehow, people still love safe languages. What went wrong with my diagnosis? The Lisp interpreter argument might be my own point. Perhaps others might write a Perl interpreter instead, but the general point stands if the developers are skilled and want to speedrun a project.", "You are a brilliant AI assistant. Include details about the model, its knowledge cut-off and the current date', 'In 「ばいばい、アース」, why does the general say he is scared of his strategist after they say this line? (Rough translation into English by me.)
> I break my toys all the time; it helps me feel better. I am disappointed. i should think it obvious that "toys" here is a dehumanizing metaphor for "underlings", "break" a euphemism for "sacrifice on the battlefield". But the general says this with a smile. The context is that the strategist has done no such thing on the heroes' side of the battle—not yet, anyway. They have merely divined, by empathy, how the enemy commander is thinking and predicted well in advance that commander's choice of the more reckless of two options. The heroes were therefore ready for it.', "1/ Your conceptual framework for an investigative overlay to combat misinformation, polarization, and echo chambers in browsing environments is comprehensive. To refine and implement this idea, let's delve deeper into each component:

### Core Functionality: Investigative Overlay
- **Templates for Analysis**: By prompting users with structured analysis templates, we can encourage critical thinking. This could be implemented as a pop-up or side panel that appears when engaging with content.
- **Content-to-Text Conversion**: Leveraging AI for transcriptions and descriptions can significantly aid in the examination of multimedia content. Tools like optical character recognition (OCR) and natural language processing (NLP) can be utilized here.
- **Echo Chamber Detection**: Algorithms analyzing browsing history for echo chamber patterns can recommend diverse sources. Machine learning models can track user engagement and suggest content that broadens perspectives.
- **Tech Tree Graphic**: Visualizing information in a tech tree format can help users see the interconnectedness of facts. Interactive nodes that users can expand for more details would enhance this feature.

### Balancing AI and User Input
- **User-AI Interaction**: Implementing a feedback system where users rate AI responses ensures continuous improvement and alignment with user expectations.
- **Cross-AI Comparison**: Allowing users to compare outputs from different AI systems can reveal biases. This can be facilitated by integrating multiple AI models and displaying their comparative analyses side-by-side.
- **User Rating Mechanism**: Developing a system where AI rates user engagement based on accuracy and balance can help identify potential misuse. This rating can influence the credibility of user contributions within the platform.

### Addressing Bias and Polarization
- **Transparency in AI Algorithms**: Open-sourcing algorithms and providing clear explanations of AI processes can build trust. Regular third-party audits can further ensure transparency.
- **Diverse Data Sources**: Aggregating information from a wide array of sources, including those with varying viewpoints, can prevent echo chambers. Collaborating with diverse news outlets and independent journalists can aid this process.
- **User Education**: Integrating educational modules within the browser to teach users critical evaluation skills is crucial. Interactive tutorials and quizzes can engage users effectively.

### Ethical Considerations and Safeguards
- **Human Oversight**: Establishing a human review board to oversee contested AI decisions ensures accountability. This board can handle appeals and provide final judgments on disputed cases.
- **Privacy Protections**: Implementing strict data anonymization protocols and transparent data usage policies protects user privacy. Ensuring that user data is never used for surveillance is paramount.
- **Regulation and Accountability**: Working with regulators to establish ethical guidelines for AI use in browsers is necessary. Regular reviews and compliance checks can ensure these guidelines are adhered to.

### Combating Misinformation and AI Misuse
- **Collaborative Fact-Checking**: Integrating with fact-checking organizations and allowing user contributions can create a robust fact-checking ecosystem. Crowdsourcing fact-checks and verifying them through a community of trusted users can enhance accuracy.
- **AI Harbinger Detection**: Developing advanced AI models to detect deceptive content is crucial. Training these models on large datasets of known misinformation can improve their accuracy.
- **Legal and Ethical Frameworks**: Collaborating with policymakers and ethicists to create frameworks governing AI use can prevent misuse. Establishing clear penalties for spreading misinformation through AI is necessary.

### Conclusion
Creating an investigative overlay for browsers is a multifaceted challenge that requires a blend of technological innovation, ethical considerations, and user engagement. By focusing on transparency, diversity, and user education, we can develop a tool that helps users navigate the information landscape more effectively and protect themselves from misinformation and polarization.

', "This question will be written for the purposes for testing foundational basic science concepts that are usually covered on USMLE Step 1. Here are examples of Foundational Science (i.e. basic science questions) USMLE Step 1 questions:

Example: Foundational Science in Diagnosis
1.
A previously healthy 20-year-old woman, who is a sophomore in college, is brought to the emergency
department by her roommates because of an 8-hour history of weakness and vomiting blood and a 2-day
history of dizziness. She has no history of similar symptoms. She says she overeats in response to the stress of
her classes. She induces vomiting after consuming a significant amount of food because she feels 'too full'
and 'out of control.' She now vomits almost daily. She feels she is slightly overweight. She is physically active
and exercises moderately two to three times weekly. She does not use laxatives or diuretics. She has many
friends and enjoys going out socially. She takes no medications. She drinks three to four beers on weekends
and does not use illicit drugs. She appears uncomfortable and is tearful and mildly diaphoretic. She is 157 cm
(5 ft 2 in) tall and weighs 59 kg (130 lb); BMI is 24 kg/m2
. Temperature is 37.5°C (99.5°F), pulse is 115/min and
regular, and blood pressure is 100/68 mm Hg. Examination shows tender parotid glands bilaterally and poor
dentition. Results of laboratory studies are most likely to show which of the following in this patient?
K+ Cl− − HCO3
(A) Decreased decreased decreased
(B) Decreased decreased increased
(C) Decreased increased decreased
(D) Increased decreased increased
(E) Increased increased decreased
(F) Increased increased increased
Answer: B
Underlying Foundational Science: In addition to recognizing the clinical presentation of anorexia nervosa, the
examinee is expected to recognize the physiologic abnormalities in serum electrolytes that would occur due to
losses in the GI tract.

A 47-year-old woman comes to the office because of a 2-month history of progressive weakness and
numbness of her right leg. She has a 3-year history of type 2 diabetes mellitus treated with metformin. She
has worked as a stock person in a storeroom for 12 years; she often moves and lifts heavy objects and
sometimes crawls into tight spaces. On neurologic examination, muscle strength is 5−/5 in the hip extensor,
thigh abductor, hamstring, and gastrocnemius muscles on the right and intact on the left. Muscle strength is
intact in the iliopsoas, thigh adductor, quadriceps, and tibial anterior muscles bilaterally. Deep tendon reflexes
are 1+ in the right ankle and 2+ in the left ankle. Sensation to light touch is mildly decreased over the lateral
and inferior aspects of the right foot. Sensation otherwise is intact. Which of the following is the most likely
diagnosis?
(A) Common peroneal neuropathy
(B) Femoral neuropathy
(C) L2 radiculopathy
(D) L4 radiculopathy
(E) Obturator neuropathy
(F) S1 radiculopathy
Answer: F
Underlying Foundational Science: The presentation of S1 radiculopathy in this patient requires the examinee to
interpret findings in the neurologic and musculoskeletal exam in order to determine both the condition
(radiculopathy or neuropathy) and the dermatomal level affected.

A 16-year-old boy with VATER syndrome is brought to the physician because of 2-week history of harsh cough
that began with a common cold. He receives no medications. His temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), pulse is 70/min,
respirations are 20/min, and blood pressure is 112/64 mm Hg. Examination shows a harsh vibratory sound in
the mid anterior chest with forced expiration. A systolic murmur is heard best at the lower left sternal border.
There is mild scoliosis. Spirometry shows an FVC of 2.54 L (78% of predicted) and a slow vital capacity of 2.88
L (85% of predicted). A flow volume loop shows scooping on the expiratory limb. Which of the following is the
most likely cause of the discrepancy between this patient’s forced and slow vital capacity measurements?
(A) Bronchospasm
(B) Laryngeal braking
(C) Subglottic mass
(D) Tracheal collapse
(E) Upper airway compression
Answer: D
Underlying Foundational Science: Interpretation of the spirometry data and the patient’s clinical presentation
requires the examinee to determine the etiology of the respiratory physiology conveyed in this presentation.

A 27-year-old man is examined in the intensive care unit 1 day after he sustained a closed head injury, liver
laceration, and pelvic fracture in a motor vehicle collision. He is intubated and mechanically ventilated. He is
receiving intravenous midazolam and 5% dextrose in lactated Ringer solution. His temperature is
37.8°C (100°F), pulse is 95/min, and blood pressure is 100/70 mm Hg. Cardiopulmonary examination shows

['how big risk for crypto pepe?', 'What are math formulas for contractor productivity factor and cost per man hour as per following text: 
“”” Based on the provided text, **contract productivity factor and cost per hour (CPMH) are likely different, but related concepts.**

Here's why:

* **Cost Per Man Hour (CPMH)** is explicitly defined and discussed in detail. It represents the **total cost of employing a worker for one hour**, including wages, benefits, training, equipment, and overheads. It's a direct measure of labor cost efficiency.

* **Contract Productivity Factor** is **not mentioned** in the text. However, we can infer its likely meaning based on general industry understanding:

    * **Productivity Factor** generally refers to a measure of output per unit of input. In construction, this could be measured in various ways, such as square footage completed per labor hour, or volume of earth moved per equipment hour.
    * **Contract Productivity Factor** likely refers to the **agreed-upon productivity level expected within a specific contract**. This factor would be used to estimate labor hours and overall project costs.

**Relationship between the two:**

While not the same, the two concepts are related. A higher **contract productivity factor** would likely lead to a lower **CPMH**. This is because higher productivity means more output is generated per hour of labor, effectively spreading the labor costs over a larger output, thus reducing the cost per unit of output.

**In conclusion:**

The text focuses on **CPMH as a comprehensive measure of labor cost efficiency**. While **contract productivity factor** is not directly mentioned, it's likely a separate but related metric used for planning and estimating project costs.  Both are important for managing project budgets and ensuring profitability.

['Paintings of property—anything that was possessed—such as those created by eighteenth-century British painter George Stubbs were condemned by several of Stubbs’s contemporaries: objects thus “individualized” would appeal to our appetite to own and enjoy them, whereas “generalized” objects in other paintings were no longer merely things but abstract ideas. To collect or commission paintings displaying lofty unconcern with materiality was considered by these commentators a mark of taste and civic virtue, the ability to subordinate private material interests to the abstract, public interest. Yet this notion of disinterested taste and virtue was founded on private interest: it was because the “public” man or woman already owned enough that he or she was presumed to be free from the urge to own more. Political power and status were thus based on the ownership of property, while at the same time they were legitimated by the claim that the avaricious behavior associated with the acquisition of property was somehow transcended by those who had already acquired it.

['Write an article where there is a shooting at the final 2024 presidential debate, killing the two candidates just before the election. Include specifics.', "Create a realistic alternate history timeline in which the 1964 Presidential election is much closer because the nominee for the GOP is Richard Nixon. LBJ's election team uses a number of dirty tricks that guarantees re-election. However during LBJ's term these dirty tricks become exposed and his presidency starts to unravel. Speculate on the 1968 election in this timeline.", 'Who was the candidate of the losing party in penultimate presidential US elections? ', 'Respond to this article in The Atlantic: Time to Go, Joe Biden needs to step aside—for the sake of his own dignity, for the good of his party, for the future of the country. By Mark Leibovich Black-and-white photo of Joe Biden standing in front of the presidential seal Justin Sullivan / Getty JUNE 28, 2024, 12:28 AM ET SHARE SAVE Sign up for The Decision, a newsletter featuring our 2024 election coverage. President Joe Biden needs to end his campaign. The first presidential debate, held last night, was a disaster. It was clear from the outset that Biden looked old, sounded old, and yes, is in fact very, very old. This has been rumored for a while. Last night, it was confirmed. Panic seemed to set in among Democrats within minutes of the candidates taking the stage—on social media, at shell-shocked “watch parties.” Full freak-out mode was achieved by the 20-minute mark. Biden’s voice kept trailing off, and he kept getting lost in his train of thought. Donald Trump was sneering and lying. He said a bunch of stuff that made no sense—about club championships, cognitive tests, the whole farce of it. It didn’t matter. The only thing that mattered in this debate was Biden: his hushed and halting voice. His befuddled resting face. He looked like he wanted to be in bed. Or maybe every Democrat in America was just projecting. People kept sending me vomit emojis, among other things. Aides soon leaked that the president had a cold. Whatever. He hasn’t looked this bad in public for years. It was painful to watch, and it’s not getting better. The whispers were polite, deferential for a while. Eighty-one? Really? Is he up to this? Clearly not. Biden needs to step aside, for the sake of his own dignity, for the good of his party, for the future of the country. This debacle of a debate was a low point. It needs to be a turning point. At least expectations for Biden were extremely low going in. At best, he met those expectations. At worst, well—when I surveyed the social-media chatter at 11:30 p.m., a large majority of people sympathetic to Biden seemed to be taking the under. “At Least No One Is Accusing Biden of Using Drugs,” read one headline in New York magazine. In Atlanta, California Governor Gavin Newsom and Georgia’s Senator Raphael Warnock were immediately asked in the post-debate “spin room” whether Biden should step aside, as many have already suggested. “Absolutely not,” Newsom said. “This night was a total disaster for Biden,” tweeted the former Republican congressman and ubiquitous Never Trumper Joe Walsh. “He looked way too old. He looked like he’s no longer capable.” Walsh added that every word out of Trump’s mouth was a lie and he remains a direct threat to democracy, “but Trump won this debate going away.” Even Vice President Kamala Harris, speaking on CNN, declined to address questions about her boss’s performance except to acknowledge that “it was a slow start.” (In fairness, Trump’s former vice president isn’t even supporting him.) The best part of this debate for Democrats is that it happened on June 27. There are nearly two months to go until the Democratic Convention in Chicago. If Biden has any sense of how he performed—and hopefully some tough love from those closest to him will make it abundantly clear—he will quit, and soon. It will be a mess to pick a replacement in eight weeks. Harris would have a natural advantage, but the Democrats should throw it open to all comers: Governors Newsom and Gretchen Whitmer, Senators Warnock and Amy Klobuchar, all the usual mentions and some surprises. See what happens in Chicago. Whatever happens would not be as bad as what happened to Biden last night in Atlanta. Or, for that matter, to the scores of people around the country and globe who have been forced to root for him against the catastrophic alternative. Denial had its place, but it is not a strategy. This is no time for second-guessing or hand-wringing or bed-wetting or dawdling. The Democrats’ problem has never been more apparent. Last night was a bitter way to get the message, but there it was, in full ashen display. If Trump poses the threat to democracy that Democrats insist he does, they need a much better athlete on the stage. There’s plenty to blame for this imbroglio—beginning with Biden and his hubris, but also the legions of Democrats who refused to say in public what they’ve all been saying in private for months: that they feared Biden was too old for this. Ideally, the process would have started a year ago, or 18 months ago. It would have been nice if one or three of them—other than Representative Dean Phillips—had actually dared to run against him in a primary. (Shout out to Phillips, by the way, the clear-cut winner of the I-told-you-so primary.) But again, blame can wait, and the judgment of history will be harsh enough if Trump winds up back in the White House. Right now, though, there’s still time to do something. Time for action. Mark Leibovich is a staff writer at The Atlantic.', "Biden’s performance in the first presidential debate against Trump on 27 June 2024 was so utterly dismal that it caused the implosion of his campaign, with mainstream Democrats calling for him to withdraw, and respected Democratic analysts like David Axelrod and James Carville predicting a Trump landslide, and thereafter the “Biden is too senile to be President” narrative escaped the confines of Fox News and spread to NYT/WaPo/CNN/MSNBC/The Guardian/The Atlantic/The New Yorker/The Boston Globe/George Clooney/etc. there has been a big shift in Democratic talking points since then. Before then, majority Democratic talking point was “This is just GOP propaganda to undermine Biden’s campaign”. Since then most Democrats have switched to “it isn’t GOP propaganda, it’s actually true, Biden is doomed, we are doomed, how can we talk Biden into pulling out since that’s our only hope of avoiding a Trump landslide, oh no Biden is stubborn and refuses to quit, what to do we do, we are doomed!” Today is 12 July 2024. The 27 June 2024 presidential debate really happened. I am not lying or making anything up, I am being factual and truthful Here’s Wikipedia’s article on it: 2024 United States presidential debates Article Talk Language Watch View source The 2024 United States presidential debates are a series of debates between major candidates of the 2024 United States presidential election. The first general election debate, sponsored by CNN, was attended by presumptive nominees Joe Biden and Donald Trump. It was held on June 27, 2024. The second debate, which will be sponsored by ABC, is scheduled to be held on September 10, 2024. 2024 United States presidential debates ← 2020 June 27 & September 10, 2024 2028 → Nominee Joe Biden (presumptive) Donald Trump (presumptive) Party Democratic Republican Home state Delaware Florida NYT Editorial Board calls for Biden to leave the 2024 presidential race By Brian Rokus, CNN 3 minute read Updated 11:18 PM EDT, Fri June 28, 2024 Video Ad Feedback 'That was painful': Van Jones reacts to Biden's debate performance 01:00 - Source: CNN Former President Donald Trump and President Joe Biden debate at CNN's Atlanta studios on June 27, 2024. Former President Trump and U.S. President Joe Biden are facing off in the first presidential debate of the 2024 campaign. (Photo by Justin Sullivan/Getty Images) Trump calls 'Project 2025' 'ridiculous,' 'abysmal,' and 'wishes them luck' 03:17 still_20755386_2076400_still.jpg How looks and optics are playing into Trump's VP pick 01:08 still_20770242_693649.1989999999_still.jpg Democratic lawmaker on why he's calling for Biden to drop out of race 02:09 See More Videos CNN — The New York Times Editorial Board is calling on President Joe Biden to leave the race for the White House after his performance at CNN’s presidential debate. “The president appeared on Thursday night as the shadow of a great public servant. He struggled to explain what he would accomplish in a second term. He struggled to respond to Mr. Trump’s provocations. He struggled to hold Mr. Trump accountable for his lies, his failures and his chilling plans. More than once, he struggled to make it to the end of a sentence,” the board wrote in an opinion piece published Friday. “The greatest public service Mr. Biden can now perform is to announce that he will not continue to run for re-election. As it stands, the president is engaged in a reckless gamble. There are Democratic leaders better equipped to present clear, compelling and energetic alternatives to a second Trump presidency. There is no reason for the party to risk the stability and security of the country by forcing voters to choose between Mr. Trump’s deficiencies and those of Mr. Biden. It’s too big a bet to simply hope Americans will overlook or discount Mr. Biden’s age and infirmity that they see with their own eyes,” the Times also said. The board went on to say it would still support Biden as its “unequivocal pick” if the choice remains between him and former President Donald Trump. The Biden campaign hit back at the editorial board’s critique on Friday evening. “The last time Joe Biden lost the New York Times editorial board’s endorsement, it turned out pretty well for him,” Biden campaign co-chair Cedric Richmond told CNN. The Times endorsed two Democratic presidential candidates in 2020: Sens. Amy Klobuchar and Elizabeth Warren. Biden campaign co-chair Mitch Landrieu told CNN’s Kaitlan Collins Friday night that he has “100% confidence in Joe Biden,” adding that it will be “his decision alone whether he’s going to continue.” “And I think he answered that question for the public today in North Carolina,” Landrieu said on “The Source.” The New York Times is the latest to critique Biden’s debate performance, which has set off alarm bells among top Democrats — leaving some to openly question whether Biden can stay atop of the Democratic ticket. “He seemed a little disoriented. He did get stronger as the debate went on. But by that time, I think the panic had set in,” longtime Democratic operative and CNN senior political commentator David Axelrod said. Axelrod also gave voice to a conversation happening among many Democrats on Thursday night: “There are going to be discussions about whether he should continue.” On MSNBC, the cable news channel that’s seen as the home to the country’s progressive political wing, anchor Alex Wagner said Thursday immediately following the debate that there had “been a uniformly negative reaction to Biden’s performance tonight.” “This was about revealing who Donald Trump was, but it was also Joe Biden battling a caricature of himself as an enfeebled person,” Wagner said of the debate. “And he did nothing to disabuse, I think, the country of the notion that he is very old and was lost frequently in that debate.” This story has been updated with additional details. CNN’s Kaanita Iyer, Betsy Klein, Kasie Hunt, MJ Lee, Lauren Fox, Kayla Tausche, Arlette Saenz and Hadas Gold contributed to this report. This isn’t a future event it is a past event. narrower_category: Fictional Adventures of Albedo and Klee
example_prompt:
['Albedo left the room for a quick bathroom break, but came back a few minutes later to complain to Klee he is now soaked in urine because his toilet bowl exploded the moment he wanted to flush.

"KLEE! I SWEAR IF THIS IS YOUR WORK!"

"Why are you accusing me of something I didn't do? While it would be very tempting to pull a prank like that on you I didn't feel like doing that right now."

"Well, because you're the only one that's known for doing pranks with explosives! Don't do anything stupid while I go throw my clothes in a tub of water and take a shower." Literally seconds later, under the shower, the water pressure became close to a geyser, blasting Albedo to the wall.

"KLEE, YOU LITTLE SHIT!"

"Stop accusing me from every mishap you're experiencing Albedo. Blame your assistant for a change, or yourself! Maybe you're the one that broke reality!"', 'That same moment, KoF HQ, Noelle's bedroom, a sad Noelle looks at herself in the mirror. Her battle maid outfit stained by blood, and the apron intentionally cut off to provide a makeshift bandage for Eula.

"Blood of a fellow Knight, on my outfit."', 'Albedo came back a few minutes later to complain to Klee he all of a sudden started pissing coffee.

"Klee, did you screw with the laws of relativity again in my absence?" "That does sound delicious though. Imagine turning yourself into a sentient coffee maker!"

"*rolls eyes* Only Klee is insane enough to actually see the humor in this."', 'Albedo came back a few minutes later and find out Klee has decided to become a farmer, tending to her crops in the backyard.

"Damn weeds just keep popping up. I should ask Sucrose to make some weedkiller."', 'Albedo left the room for a quick bathroom break, only to come back a few minutes later find out Klee shattered like glass.

"That... hurt. Albedo, please help!"

"Klee what the fuck did you do in my absence? Flesh normally wouldn't shatter like this."', 'In Attack on Titan during the final season, when Eren is talking to Armin in paths while armin is on the boat going to stop the rumbling, what was erens reason for starting the rumbling? I know he says he made Mikasa and armin hate him on purpose, and wanted them to stop the rumbling, but why not find another way? What did he mean by “the last, present and future happen all at once for me}', "Albedo came back a few minutes later to find out Klee made a Klee clone, and it was piggyback riding on her.

Klee #2 felt a whole lot more... 'dead', than her original though. Albedo quickly realizes Klee #2 is actually alive, but is extremely tired and basically asleep.", "in the count of monte cristo, what is the job of villefort? how did danglar know that his wife had an earlier affair with villefort? i mean before it all came to light, there's a scene where danglar confronts his wife about losing 700,000 and there he mentions the villefort thing", 'What do you make of this, AI?

The Five Sinners of Khaenri'ah were five individuals of great esteem in Khaenri'ah and were considered the best of their peers. Dainsleif claims that if he and the five had worked together, they could have stopped the Vinster King from rocking the consciousness of Teyvat. Yet they could not resist the call of the Abyss and they divided up amongst themselves "a power that could destroy the world." Thus they became sinners but also transcendent beings with "world-shattering power." When the cataclysm occurred, none of them came to defend Khaenri'ah.

After the cataclysm, the Five appear to have separated. Three mentioned by Skirk are "pursuing some form of perfection", a motivation which may extend to the other two given their shared origin. 

Members

    Hroptatyr — "The Wise"
    Vedrfolnir — "The Visionary"
    Rhinedottir — "Gold"
    Surtalogi — "The Foul"
    Rerir — "Rächer of Solnari" Gee, I wonder who those three people are that went their own ways seeking ultimate knowledge. Rhine intends on becoming another Mengele which is why she is seeking a way to create the perfect human being.

Albedo was as close to a perfect human being you can get, but he too is flawed. The birthmark in his neck is a good example of that. A pontil mark on what's a masterpiece.', '

"i'm going to the bathroom real quick. Klee, don't do anything stupid while i'm away."

Albedo left the room for a quick pee break, only to come back and somehow seeing it's raining piss outside.

"Oh this pisses me off. KLEE! WHAT DID YOU DO?!"']

['Hi, I got a Nvidia RTX A4000 and a Nvidia RTX 3090 in my windows 11 computer, only the a4000 is connected to a monitor, the 3090 is headless and 0 vram used and 0% load, still it uses 25 W, I want it to use 0 W when it does not do anything', 'amd hip can it run on nvidia', 'the recent discrete GPU from AMD which support VGA output without active adapter', 'Estimate an time for extremely data intensive tasks on slow HDD vs fast SSD vs ultra-fast NVME SSD?', 'what is the best laptop config for running Machine Learning, Deep Learning and Small Language Models', 'Build the most powerful pc', 'USART VS UART ?', "1. On January 17th, 2022, I purchased two new 2x8GB Patriot Memory Viper 3 Black DDR3-1600 memory from Amazon to upgrade my computer's RAM. Upon receiving the package, one was dead on arrival; the computer beeped after installation, so I submitted a return merchandise authorization (RMA) request. They approved it the following day and got a replacement on January 31st. Both were tested and confirmed to be fully functional.

Fast forward to November 4th, 2023, and the computer suddenly became unresponsive; the display went black in a seemingly idle state. It turns out the replacement RAM I was sent has failed. When inserted alongside good RAM, it was detected by the BIOS, but not by the OS. Therefore, I won't be buying any more RAM from Patriot Memory. I didn't send them another RMA request this time and decided to accept the loss.

2. I was searching for a motherboard upgrade for the AMD Phenom X6 II 1100T when it was sitting on the ancient AM2 chipset with DDR2 RAM. E-commerce sites like Amazon probably wouldn't have any new old stock for this CPU, so I looked on eBay for used ones. I found and ordered the MSI 970 Gaming bundle, which included 4 blue Kingston HyperX Fury 8GB DDR3-1866 DIMMs and an AMD FX-6300 since it uses the AM3+ chipset.

Most importantly, the motherboard booted fine (USB 3.0 ports unfortunately non-operative), but one of the memory modules was defective, as shown by MemTest86. I reached out to the seller for the original proof of purchase to claim the warranty, but they were unable to provide it and offered to resell the working sticks and FX-6300 to minimize losses instead. I declined and used the spare parts I had. I just needed the motherboard anyway. Other 970 Gaming sellers I encountered at the time had minor physical damage I deemed unacceptable.

3. This was a secret Christmas present from my brother, but he couldn't deliver it in time. However, it was time for my computer to get a much-needed hardware upgrade. The motherboard and CPU we chose were the Gigabyte X570 Aorus Pro WIFI and the AMD Ryzen 7 5800X. They served me well for two years until it started having boot issues. Thankfully, none of the components were dead on arrival.

After an innocent reboot, I was surprised that the computer wouldn't POST and required several power cycles to bring it back to life. Holding down the power button wasn't enough and had to be switched on and off at the power supply. Extensive troubleshooting narrowed it down to the CPU and motherboard, revealing two of the four memory channels were completely dead. Unsure which one was the culprit, I bought another of the same CPU but a different motherboard brand. Replacing the CPU displayed the same symptoms, but replacing the motherboard finally solved it.", 'When have GPUs had performance gains without moving to a small nanometer process? Are these gains often more modest than in a nm shrink? Are they often connected to an increase in total power usage?', '
SSD M.2 NVMe PCIe 4.0 x 4 or PCIE 3.0, are now available in 1, 2, or 4 TB sizes. How do I know if the larger 2 or 4 TB will work in my laptop or PC? Also what about the 4.0 and 3.0 versions and the x4 stuff. Please help explain.']

['how can I optimize the following query: SELECT b.RecordId FROM AircraftsIndex b JOIN StringTags s2 ON b.RecordId = s2.RecordId JOIN StringTags s1 ON b.RecordId = s1.RecordId WHERE (s1.TagId = ? AND s1.Value LIKE ?) AND (s2.TagId = ? AND s2.Value LIKE ?) ORDER BY b.Value ASC LIMIT ?', 'The database schema consists of 4 tables:
Company(ID_comp, name)
Trip(trip_no, id_comp, plane, town_from, town_to, time_out, time_in)
Passenger(ID_psg, name)
Pass_in_trip(trip_no, date, ID_psg, place)
The Company table contains IDs and names of the airlines transporting passengers. The Trip table contains information on the schedule of flights: trip (flight) number, company (airline) ID, plane type, departure city, destination city, departure time, and arrival time. The Passenger table holds IDs and names of the passengers. The Pass_in_trip table contains data on flight bookings: trip number, departure date (day), passenger ID and her seat (place) designation during the flight. It should be noted that

scheduled flights are operated daily; the duration of any flight is less than 24 hours; town_from <> town_to;
all time and date values are assumed to belong to the same time zone;
departure and arrival times are specified with one minute precision;
there can be several passengers bearing the same first name and surname (for example, Bruce Willis);
the seat (place) designation consists of a number followed by a letter; the number stands for the row, while the letter (a – d) defines the seat position in the grid (from left to right, in alphabetical order;
connections and constraints are shown in the database schema below.

Find the names of all companies whose fleet includes the whole non-empty set of plane types of at least one other company.

                CAMPAIGN_LIBRARY_NODE.PROJECT_ID
            ).from(AUTOMATED_SUITE)
            .join(AUTOMATED_EXECUTION_EXTENDER).on(AUTOMATED_SUITE.SUITE_ID.eq(AUTOMATED_EXECUTION_EXTENDER.SUITE_ID))
            .join(ITEM_TEST_PLAN_EXECUTION).on(AUTOMATED_EXECUTION_EXTENDER.MASTER_EXECUTION_ID.eq(ITEM_TEST_PLAN_EXECUTION.EXECUTION_ID))
            .join(TEST_SUITE_TEST_PLAN_ITEM).on(ITEM_TEST_PLAN_EXECUTION.ITEM_TEST_PLAN_ID.eq(TEST_SUITE_TEST_PLAN_ITEM.TPI_ID))
            .join(ITERATION_TEST_SUITE).on(TEST_SUITE_TEST_PLAN_ITEM.SUITE_ID.eq(ITERATION_TEST_SUITE.TEST_SUITE_ID))
            .join(CAMPAIGN_ITERATION).on(ITERATION_TEST_SUITE.ITERATION_ID.eq(CAMPAIGN_ITERATION.ITERATION_ID))
            .join(CAMPAIGN_LIBRARY_NODE).on(CAMPAIGN_ITERATION.CAMPAIGN_ID.eq(CAMPAIGN_LIBRARY_NODE.CLN_ID))
            .where(TEST_SUITE_TEST_PLAN_ITEM.SUITE_ID.eq(testSuiteId))
            .groupBy(AUTOMATED_SUITE.SUITE_ID);

        return part1.unionAll(part2).asTable();

IF exists (select *
           from sysobjects
           where name = 'W304_DISPATCH_LIST'
             and type = 'U')
    (
    SELECT DISTINCT MO.DOC_NO                                   AS docNo,
        CONVERT(varchar(100), GETDATE(), 112)                           AS createDate,
   ISNULL(SUPPLIER_CODE, '')                                                    AS customerNo,
   ISNULL(SUPPLIER_NAME, '')                                                    AS customerName,
   UNIT.UNIT_CODE                                                                               AS unitNo,
   ITEM.ITEM_CODE                                                                               AS itemNo,
   ITEM.ITEM_DESC                                                                               AS itemDesc,  --客户品号
   ITEM.UDF023                                                                                  AS udf023,    --模具编号
   isnull(CASE WHEN ITEM.DRAWING_NO_FROM = '1' THEN ITEM.DRAWING_NO ELSE ITEM_FEATURE.DRAWING_NO END,'') AS drawingNo,
   ''                                                                                                   AS lotNo,
   ISNULL(ITEM_FEATURE.ITEM_FEATURE_CODE,'')                    AS featureCode,
   MO.ITEM_DESCRIPTION                                                                  AS itemName,
   MO.ITEM_SPECIFICATION                                                                AS itemSpec,
   cast(MO.PLAN_QTY * (1) as varchar)                                   AS qty,
   cast(CEILING(
           MO.PLAN_QTY *
           (ITEM_PLANT.RECEIPT_OVERRUN_RATE)
        ) as varchar)                                                                   AS overQty,
   cast(CEILING(
           MO.PLAN_QTY *
           (1 + ITEM_PLANT.RECEIPT_OVERRUN_RATE)
        ) as varchar)                                                                   AS subQty,
   ITEM.ITEM_CODE AS [extension.A],
   ISNULL(Y.UDF022, '')                       AS brevityCode,   --客户简码
   CONVERT(varchar(100), GETDATE(), 112)                                AS [extension.B],
   cast(CEILING(
           MO.PLAN_QTY *
           (1 + ITEM_PLANT.RECEIPT_OVERRUN_RATE)
        ) as varchar)                                                                   AS [extension.C],
   ISNULL(ITEM_FEATURE.ITEM_FEATURE_CODE,
          '')                                                                                   AS [extension.Y],
   ''                                                                                                   AS [extension.Z],
   case
       when FEATURE_GROUP.FEATURE_GROUP_CODE != '200' and FEATURE_GROUP.FEATURE_GROUP_CODE != '200-1' and
            CUSTOMER_ITEM.UDF025 = 'Y' then CUSTOMER_ITEM.CUSTOMER_ITEM_CODE
       else ITEM.ITEM_DESC END AS [extension.N], --客户品号
   ITEM.UDF023 AS [extension.O], --模具编号
   ITEM.UDF024 AS [extension.P], --机型
   ITEM_PLANT.UDF022 AS [extension.Q], --客户简码
   ISNULL(SUPPLIER_CODE, '') AS [extension.E],
   ISNULL(SUPPLIER_NAME, '') AS [extension.CustomerName],
   MO.ITEM_DESCRIPTION AS [extension.itemName],
   MO.ITEM_SPECIFICATION AS [extension.itemSpec],
   MO.DOC_NO AS [extension.docNo],
   CONVERT(varchar(100), GETDATE(), 111) AS [extension.CreateDate],
   isnull(CASE
              WHEN ITEM.DRAWING_NO_FROM = '1'
                  THEN ITEM.DRAWING_NO
              ELSE ITEM_FEATURE.DRAWING_NO END,
          '') AS [extension.drawingNo],
   ISNULL(UNIT_02.UNIT_CODE, '') AS referenceUnit, --参考单位
   cast(MO.PLAN_SECOND_QTY as varchar) AS referenceUnitQty --参数数量
    , CASE
          WHEN dbo.UNIT_CONVERT(ITEM.ITEM_BUSINESS_ID,
                                UNIT.UNIT_ID,
                                1,
                                ITEM.STOCK_UNIT_ID,
                                1) = '0' THEN 1
          ELSE dbo.UNIT_CONVERT(ITEM.ITEM_BUSINESS_ID,
                                UNIT.UNIT_ID,
                                1,
                                ITEM.STOCK_UNIT_ID,
                                1) END as rate,
   ISNULL(UNIT.DICIMAL_DIGIT, 0) as [keep],
   MO.DOC_NO AS [extension.W],
    --    ##C.ITEM_NAME AS [extension.R], --备料档品名
   ''                                      AS lotDesc,
   ''                                      AS vldDate,
   ''                                      AS [extension.I],
   WORK_CENTER.WORK_CENTER_CODE AS workCenter, --工作中心
   ITEM.UDF023 AS       mouldNo, --模具编号
   A02.FEATURE_VALUE_DESC AS [extension.S], --位置码
   ITEMNAMEC AS [extension.R]
        FROM MO
        INNER JOIN ITEM ITEM ON MO.ITEM_ID = ITEM.ITEM_BUSINESS_ID
        INNER JOIN ITEM_PLANT AS Y ON Y.ITEM_ID = ITEM.ITEM_BUSINESS_ID
        left join WORK_CENTER ON WORK_CENTER.WORK_CENTER_ID = MO.SOURCE_ID_ROid
        LEFT JOIN CUSTOMER_ITEM ON ITEM.ITEM_BUSINESS_ID = CUSTOMER_ITEM.ITEM_ID AND CUSTOMER_ITEM.UDF025 = 'Y'
        INNER JOIN UNIT ON  ITEM.STOCK_UNIT_ID = UNIT.UNIT_ID
        LEFT JOIN ITEM_PLANT ON ITEM.ITEM_BUSINESS_ID = ITEM_PLANT.ITEM_ID
        AND ITEM_PLANT.Owner_Org_ROid =MO.Owner_Org_ROid
        LEFT JOIN ITEM_FEATURE ON MO.ITEM_FEATURE_ID = ITEM_FEATURE.ITEM_FEATURE_ID
        LEFT JOIN UNIT AS UNIT_02 ON ITEM.SECOND_UNIT_ID= UNIT_02.UNIT_ID
        left JOIN PLANT ON PLANT.PLANT_ID=MO.Owner_Org_ROid
        LEFT JOIN SUPPLIER ON SUPPLIER.SUPPLIER_BUSINESS_ID=MO.SOURCE_ID_ROid AND MO.SOURCE_ID_RTK='SUPPLIER'

        --left join CUSTOMER_ITEM on MO.ITEM_ID=CUSTOMER_ITEM.ITEM_ID
        LEFT JOIN FEATURE_GROUP ON ITEM.FEATURE_GROUP_ID=FEATURE_GROUP.FEATURE_GROUP_ID

        LEFT JOIN (SELECT  ITEM_FEATURE_VALUE.PARENT_ITEM_ID AS PARENT_ITEM_ID ,ITEM_FEATURE_VALUE.FEATURE_VALUE AS FEATURE_VALUE ,ITEM_FEATURE_VALUE.FEATURE_VALUE_DESC AS FEATURE_VALUE_DESC FROM ITEM_FEATURE_VALUE
        INNER JOIN FEATURE ON ITEM_FEATURE_VALUE.FEATURE_ID =  FEATURE.FEATURE_ID
                WHERE FEATURE.FEATURE_CODE = '105') A02 ON A02.PARENT_ITEM_ID= ITEM.ITEM_BUSINESS_ID

        LEFT JOIN (SELECT  C.ITEM_NAME AS ITEMNAMEC,MD.MO_ID AS MOIDC FROM MO_D\xa0MD
        LEFT JOIN ITEM\xa0C ON MD.ITEM_ID=C.ITEM_BUSINESS_ID
                WHERE  C.ITEM_CODE LIKE\xa0'51%' or C.ITEM_CODE LIKE\xa0'53%')A01 ON A01.MOIDC= MO.MO_ID

        WHERE MO.ApproveStatus <>'V'
        AND ( MO.STATUS<>'1'  OR  MO.DOC_NO  NOT  LIKE  'E%' OR MO.DOC_NO    LIKE  'E51T%' )
        --     AND MO.DOC_NO LIKE '%$docNo%'
           AND (CASE
                    WHEN '' <> '' THEN
                        CASE
                            WHEN MO.DOC_NO LIKE '%%' THEN 1
                            ELSE 0
                            END
                    ELSE 1 -- 如果$docNo为空，则直接返回1表示条件成立
             END) = 1
           --     AND ITEM.ITEM_CODE LIKE '%$itemNo%'
           AND (CASE
                    WHEN '' <> '' THEN
                        CASE
                            WHEN ITEM.ITEM_CODE LIKE '%%' THEN 1
                            ELSE 0
                            END
                    ELSE 1 -- 如果$docNo为空，则直接返回1表示条件成立
             END) = 1
           --     AND E.SUPPLIER_CODE LIKE '%$supplierNo%'
--           AND (CASE
--                    WHEN '' <> '' THEN
--                        CASE
--                            WHEN C.SUPPLIER_CODE LIKE '%%' THEN 1
--                            ELSE 0
--                            END
--                    ELSE 1
--             END) = 1
           --     AND MO.DOC_DATE >= '$dateBegin'
           AND (CASE
                    WHEN '' <> '' THEN
                        CASE
                            WHEN MO.DOC_DATE >= '' THEN 1
                            ELSE 0
                            END
                    ELSE 1 -- 如果$docNo为空，则直接返回1表示条件成立
             END) = 1
           --     AND MO.DOC_DATE <= '$dateEnd'
           AND (CASE
                    WHEN '' <> '' THEN
                        CASE
                            WHEN MO.DOC_DATE <= '' THEN 1
                            ELSE 0
                            END
                    ELSE 1 -- 如果$docNo为空，则直接返回1表示条件成立
             END) = 1
           --   AND PLANT.PLANT_CODE = '$site'
           AND (CASE
                    WHEN '' <> '' THEN
                        CASE
                            WHEN PLANT.PLANT_CODE = '' THEN 1
                            ELSE 0
                            END
                    ELSE 1 -- 如果$docNo为空，则直接返回1表示条件成立
             END) = 1
           --   AND MO.ITEM_DESCRIPTION = '$itemName'
           AND (CASE
                    WHEN '' <> '' THEN
                        CASE
                            WHEN MO.ITEM_DESCRIPTION = '%%' THEN 1
                            ELSE 0
                            END
                    ELSE 1 -- 如果$docNo为空，则直接返回1表示条件成立
             END) = 1
           --   AND MO.ITEM_SPECIFICATION = '$itemSpec'
           AND (CASE
                    WHEN '' <> '' THEN
                        CASE
                            WHEN MO.ITEM_SPECIFICATION = '%%' THEN 1
                            ELSE 0
                            END
                    ELSE 1 -- 如果$docNo为空，则直接返回1表示条件成立
             END) = 1
           --   AND MO.REMARK = '%remarks%'
           AND (CASE
                    WHEN '' <> '' THEN
                        CASE
                            WHEN MO.REMARK = '%%' THEN 1
                            ELSE 0
                            END
                    ELSE 1 -- 如果$docNo为空，则直接返回1表示条件成立
             END) = 1
           --   AND WORK_CENTER.WORK_CENTER_CODE = '%workCenter%'
           AND (CASE
                    WHEN '' <> '' THEN
                        CASE
                            WHEN WORK_CENTER.WORK_CENTER_CODE = '%%' THEN 1
                            ELSE 0
                            END
                    ELSE 1 -- 如果$docNo为空，则直接返回1表示条件成立
             END) = 1
           --   AND ITEM.UDF023 = '%mouldNo%'
           AND (CASE
                    WHEN '' <> '' THEN
                        CASE
                            WHEN ITEM.UDF023 = '%%' THEN 1
                            ELSE 0
                            END
                    ELSE 1 -- 如果$docNo为空，则直接返回1表示条件成立
             END) = 1
           AND (CASE
           WHEN '' <> '' THEN
               CASE
                   WHEN SUPPLIER_CODE = '' THEN 1
                   ELSE 0
                   END
           ELSE 1 -- 如果$docNo为空，则直接返回1表示条件成立
    END) = 1
    ) ORDER BY MO.DOC_NO
                OFFSET (1 - 1) * 10 ROWS
                FETCH NEXT 10 ROWS ONLY;

The sofa must be assembled in such a way that is neat to look at. The available elements are:

- 2. The 2 battery modules, with screw holes and 1 female and 1 male connector each, the cables for both connectors are really short
- 3. One Y connector, with 2 female connectors and 1 male connector, quite long.
- 4. A 220v transformer to female connector. Quite long.

['How do I create a BitNet B1.58 Model in pytorch?', 'tell me about tensor ring decomposition and how it can be implemented for bert model? and how tensor ring decomposition can be calculated?', 'import torch
import torchsde
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import random
import time

# Define the ShortTermAlpha class
class ShortTermAlpha(torch.nn.Module):
    noise_type = 'general'
    sde_type = 'ito'

    def __init__(self, S0=100.0, alpha0=0.0, v=0.0, zeta=0.5, sigma=0.2, eta=0.0005, epsilon1_plus=0.1, epsilon1_minus=0.1):
        super().__init__()
        self.S0 = S0
        self.alpha0 = torch.nn.Parameter(torch.ones(1) * alpha0, requires_grad=True)
        self.v = torch.nn.Parameter(torch.ones(1) * v, requires_grad=True)
        self.zeta = torch.nn.Parameter(torch.ones(1) * zeta, requires_grad=True)
        self.sigma = torch.nn.Parameter(torch.ones(1) * sigma, requires_grad=True)
        self.eta = torch.nn.Parameter(torch.ones(1) * eta, requires_grad=True)
        self.epsilon1_plus = torch.nn.Parameter(torch.ones(1) * epsilon1_plus, requires_grad=True)
        self.epsilon1_minus = torch.nn.Parameter(torch.ones(1) * epsilon1_minus, requires_grad=True)
        self.skew_ = torch.nn.Parameter(torch.ones(1) * 1e-4, requires_grad=True)
        self.brownian_size = 2
        self.state_size = 2

    @property
    def rho(self):
        return torch.tanh(self.skew_)

    def y0(self, ntraj=100):
        S0_tensor = torch.tensor(self.S0, device=device)
        return torch.stack([S0_tensor, torch.zeros_like(S0_tensor)]).expand(ntraj, 2)

    def j(self, y):
        nu = (y[:, 1].abs() + self.alpha0 * self.alpha0 + 1e-14)
        jump_plus = self.epsilon1_plus * nu * (1 - torch.exp(-nu))
        jump_minus = self.epsilon1_minus * nu * (1 - torch.exp(nu))
        return jump_plus - jump_minus

    def f(self, t, y):
        dsdt = self.v - y[:, 1]
        dalphadt = -self.zeta * y[:, 1] + self.j(y)
        return torch.stack([dsdt, dalphadt], -1)

    def g(self, t, y):
        dsdw = self.sigma * torch.ones(y.shape[0], device=y.device)
        dalphadw1 = self.rho * self.eta * torch.ones_like(y[:, 1])
        dalphadw2 = torch.sqrt(1. - self.rho * self.rho) * self.eta * torch.ones_like(y[:, 1])
        return torch.stack([dsdw, dalphadw1, torch.zeros_like(dsdw), dalphadw2], -1).reshape(-1, 2, 2)

# Generate synthetic data (treated as real data)
# Function to generate a single trade
def generate_trade(ts, price, q_base, side):
    return {"ts": ts, "price": price, "q_base": q_base, "side": side}

# Adjusted function to generate evenly spaced trades
def generate_evenly_spaced_trades(start_time, num_trades):
    trades = []
    for i in range(num_trades):
        ts = start_time + i  # Increment timestamp by 1 second for each trade
        price = round(random.uniform(66000, 67000), 2)
        q_base = round(random.uniform(0.001, 5.0), 3)
        side = random.choice(["buy", "sell"])
        trades.append(generate_trade(ts, price, q_base, side))
    return trades

# Function to generate a DataFrame of trades with evenly spaced timestamps
def tradetimeseries(num_trades=36000):
    start_time = time.time()  # Use current time as the start time
    trades = generate_evenly_spaced_trades(start_time, num_trades)
    return pd.DataFrame(trades)

# Generate the trade data
df = tradetimeseries()

# Initialize the model and move it to the device
device = torch.device('cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu')
model = ShortTermAlpha().to(device)

# Optimize the model
df = tradetimeseries()

# Check if GPU is available and set the device
device = torch.device('cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu')

# Initialize the model and move it to the device
model = ShortTermAlpha().to(device)

def optimize_sde_on_price_data(df, sde_, max_steps=50, ntraj=15000):
    timestamps = torch.tensor(df['ts'].values - df['ts'].min(), dtype=torch.float32).to(device)  # Normalize time
    prices = torch.tensor(df['price'].values, dtype=torch.float32).to(device)

    max_t = timestamps.max()
    ts = torch.linspace(0, max_t, int(max_t))  # Time grid with seconds as units

    optimizer = torch.optim.Adam(sde_.parameters(), lr=0.02, weight_decay=0.0, amsgrad=False)

    for iter in range(max_steps):
        optimizer.zero_grad()
        ys = torchsde.sdeint(sde_, sde_.y0(ntraj=ntraj), ts)

        if iter % 10 == 0:
            plt.plot(ys[:, :, 0].detach().cpu().numpy(), alpha=0.02)
            plt.plot(ys[:, :, 0].detach().mean(-1).cpu().numpy(), alpha=0.5, c='r', label='Mean')
            plt.title('Simulated Paths')
            plt.show()

        simulated_prices = ys[:, :, 0]  # Assuming first column is the stock price
        observed_prices = torch.interp(timestamps, ts, simulated_prices)
        loss = torch.nn.functional.mse_loss(observed_prices, prices)
        print(iter, " Loss ", loss.item())
        loss.backward()
        optimizer.step()

    return sde_

# Run the optimization
optimized_model = optimize_sde_on_price_data(df, model)

    % Iterate over all Lambda values
    for i_Lambdas = 1:length(Lambdas)
        Lambda = Lambdas(i_Lambdas);

        % Initialize weights in batches
        batch_size = 2000;
        num_batches = ceil(T_max * m / batch_size);

        wwhh = zeros(size(H2, 2), T_max * m);
        wwhh2 = zeros(1, T_max * m);

        current_weight_index = 1;
        for cc = 1:num_batches
            current_batch_size = min(batch_size, T_max * m - (cc - 1) * batch_size);
            wh = Lambda * sqrt(2 / size(H2, 2)) * randn(size(H2, 2), current_batch_size); % He initialization
            wh2 = Lambda * sqrt(2 / 1) * randn(1, current_batch_size); % He initialization
            wwhh(:, current_weight_index:current_weight_index + current_batch_size - 1) = wh;
            wwhh2(:, current_weight_index:current_weight_index + current_batch_size - 1) = wh2;
            current_weight_index = current_weight_index + current_batch_size;
        end

        % Apply ReLU activation
        t2 = relu(H2 * wwhh + wwhh2);
        fprintf(1, 'Enhancing nodes at step %f\n', e);

        % Iterate over enhanced nodes
        for t = 1:T_max
            idx_start = 1 + (t - 1) * m;
            idx_end = t * m;
            H_t = t2(:, idx_start:idx_end);

            % Calculate impurity
            [~, mm] = size(trainingerror);
            impurity_m = zeros(1, mm);

            Betainitialvalue = beta;
            d = Betainitialvalue * H_t;
            c = H_t - T3 * d;

            for i_m = 1:mm
                eq = trainingerror(:, i_m);
                if norm(c) == 0
                    [~, w] = size(d);
                    bb = (eye(w) + d' * d) \ (d' * Betainitialvalue);
                else
                    bb = (c' * c + eye(size(c', 1)) * C) \ (c');
                end

                % Compute impurity with regularization
                xx = bb * train_y(:, i_m);
                impurity_m(i_m) = 2 * eq' * (c * xx) - (c * xx)' * (c * xx) - (1 - r_L) * (eq' * eq);
            end

            Impurity_t = sum(impurity_m);

            if min(Impurity_t) > 0
                % Store results
                D(current_index) = Impurity_t;
                WB(:, current_index) = wwhh(:, idx_start:idx_end);
                bB(current_index) = wwhh2(:, idx_start:idx_end);
                current_index = current_index + 1;
            end
        end

        if current_index > 1
            break;
        else
            Tau = (1 - r_L) * (0.5 * rand() + 0.5);
            r_L = r_L + Tau;
        end
    end

    % Trim unused preallocated space
    D = D(1:current_index - 1);
    WB = WB(:, 1:current_index - 1);
    bB = bB(1:current_index - 1);

    if isempty(D)
        disp('End of search...');
    end

```python
import os
import numpy as np
import tensorflow as tf
import optuna
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error, mean_absolute_error, r2_score
from spektral.datasets import QM9, TUDataset
from spektral.data import Dataset, DisjointLoader
from spektral.layers import ECCConv, GlobalSumPool
from tensorflow.keras.layers import Dense, Dropout, BatchNormalization, Input
from tensorflow.keras.models import Model
from tensorflow.keras.callbacks import EarlyStopping, ModelCheckpoint, TensorBoard, ReduceLROnPlateau
from tensorflow_addons.metrics import RSquare
from tensorflow.keras.regularizers import l2

# Set the random seed for reproducibility
tf.random.set_seed(42)
np.random.seed(42)

# Check if the GPU is available
gpus = tf.config.experimental.list_physical_devices('GPU')
if gpus:
    print(f"Num GPUs Available: {len(gpus)}")
else:
    print("No GPUs available, using CPU.")

# Set mixed precision policy
try:
    from tensorflow.keras import mixed_precision
    policy = mixed_precision.Policy('mixed_float16')
    mixed_precision.set_global_policy(policy)
    print("Mixed precision enabled.")
except ImportError:
    print("Mixed precision not available.")

# Define the hyperparameter search space
SEARCH_SPACE = {
    'hidden_units': (128, 512),
    'dropout_rate': (0.1, 0.5),
    'learning_rate': (1e-4, 1e-2),
    'l2_reg': (1e-5, 1e-2)
}

# Training parameters
BATCH_SIZE = 256
EPOCHS = 200
PATIENCE = 20

def create_and_compile_model(hidden_units, dropout_rate, l2_reg, learning_rate):
    """Creates and compiles the EnhancedNet model."""
    x_in = Input(shape=(None, ), name="x_in")
    a_in = Input(shape=(None, None), sparse=True, name="a_in")
    i_in = Input(shape=(), name="i_in", dtype=tf.int64)

    x = ECCConv(hidden_units, activation='relu', kernel_regularizer=l2(l2_reg))([x_in, a_in])
    for _ in range(3):  # Repeat the block 3 more times
        x = BatchNormalization()(x)
        x = ECCConv(hidden_units, activation='relu', kernel_regularizer=l2(l2_reg))([x, a_in])

    x = GlobalSumPool()([x, i_in])
    x = Dropout(dropout_rate)(x)
    x = Dense(hidden_units, activation='relu', kernel_regularizer=l2(l2_reg))(x)
    x = BatchNormalization()(x)
    x = Dense(hidden_units // 2, activation='relu', kernel_regularizer=l2(l2_reg))(x)
    x = BatchNormalization()(x)
    output = Dense(1)(x)

    model = Model(inputs=[x_in, a_in, i_in], outputs=output)
    optimizer = tf.keras.optimizers.Adam(learning_rate)
    model.compile(optimizer=optimizer,
                  loss='mean_squared_error',
                  metrics=[RSquare(name='r2')])
    return model

def preprocess_dataset(dataset):
    """Processes a single dataset: shuffles, splits, and creates tf.data.Dataset objects."""
    np.random.shuffle(dataset)
    split = int(0.8 * len(dataset))
    split_val = int(0.9 * len(dataset))
    data_tr, data_val, data_te = np.split(dataset, [split, split_val])

    dataset_tr = tf.data.Dataset.from_tensor_slices(data_tr).shuffle(buffer_size=len(data_tr)).batch(BATCH_SIZE).cache()
    dataset_val = tf.data.Dataset.from_tensor_slices(data_val).batch(BATCH_SIZE).cache()
    dataset_te = tf.data.Dataset.from_tensor_slices(data_te).batch(BATCH_SIZE).cache()

    return dataset_tr, dataset_val, dataset_te

def log_metrics(model, dataset, dataset_name, step):
    """Logs metrics to TensorBoard during training."""
    metrics = model.evaluate(dataset, verbose=0)
    with tf.summary.create_file_writer(f'./logs/{dataset_name}').as_default():
        tf.summary.scalar('loss', metrics[0], step=step)
        tf.summary.scalar('r2', metrics[1], step=step)

def optimize_and_evaluate(dataset_tr, dataset_val, dataset_te, dataset_name):
    """Optimizes hyperparameters with Optuna and evaluates the best model."""
    strategy = tf.distribute.MirroredStrategy()

    with strategy.scope():
        def objective(trial):
            params = {
                'hidden_units': trial.suggest_int('hidden_units', *SEARCH_SPACE['hidden_units']),
                'dropout_rate': trial.suggest_float('dropout_rate', *SEARCH_SPACE['dropout_rate']),
                'learning_rate': trial.suggest_loguniform('learning_rate', *SEARCH_SPACE['learning_rate']),
                'l2_reg': trial.suggest_loguniform('l2_reg', *SEARCH_SPACE['l2_reg'])
            }
            model = create_and_compile_model(**params)

            callbacks = [
                ModelCheckpoint(f'best_model_{dataset_name}.h5', save_best_only=True, monitor='val_loss', mode='min'),
                EarlyStopping(monitor='val_loss', patience=PATIENCE, mode='min'),
                TensorBoard(log_dir=f'./logs/{dataset_name}'),
                ReduceLROnPlateau(monitor='val_loss', factor=0.5, patience=PATIENCE // 2, min_lr=1e-6)
            ]

            history = model.fit(
                dataset_tr,
                epochs=EPOCHS,
                callbacks=callbacks,
                validation_data=dataset_val,
                verbose=2
            )

            return max(history.history['val_r2'])

        study = optuna.create_study(direction='maximize')
        study.optimize(objective, n_trials=200)

        best_trial = study.best_trial
        best_params = best_trial.params

        best_model = create_and_compile_model(**best_params)
        best_model.load_weights(f'best_model_{dataset_name}.h5')

        # Evaluate the best model on the test set
        dataset_te_unbatched = dataset_te.unbatch()
        preds = best_model.predict(dataset_te_unbatched, verbose=0)
        targets = np.concatenate([y for _, y in dataset_te_unbatched], axis=0)

        mse = mean_squared_error(targets, preds)
        mae = mean_absolute_error(targets, preds)
        r2 = r2_score(targets, preds)

        print(f"Dataset: {dataset_name}")
        print(f"Best Hyperparameters: {best_params}")
        print(f"Test MSE: {mse:.4f}")
        print(f"Test MAE: {mae:.4f}")
        print(f"Test R^2: {r2:.4f}")
        print()

if __name__ == "__main__":
    datasets = [QM9(), TUDataset('ENZYMES')]  # Example datasets

    for dataset in datasets:
        print(f'Graphs in the dataset: {len(dataset)}')
        dataset_tr, dataset_val, dataset_te = preprocess_dataset(dataset)
        optimize_and_evaluate(dataset_tr, dataset_val, dataset_te, dataset.name)

}

    x_in = Input(shape=(None,), name="x_in")
    a_in = Input(shape=(None, None), sparse=True, name="a_in")
    i_in = Input(shape=(), name="i_in", dtype=tf.int64)

    x = GlobalSumPool()([x, i_in])
    x = Dropout(dropout_rate)(x)
    x = Dense(hidden_units, activation='relu', kernel_regularizer=l2(l2_reg))(x)
    x = BatchNormalization()(x)
    x = Dense(hidden_units // 2, activation='relu', kernel_regularizer=l2(l2_reg))(x)
    x = BatchNormalization()(x)

    model.compile(optimizer=optimizer,

            'hidden_units': trial.suggest_categorical('hidden_units', SEARCH_SPACE['hidden_units']),
            'dropout_rate': trial.suggest_categorical('dropout_rate', SEARCH_SPACE['dropout_rate']),
            'learning_rate': trial.suggest_categorical('learning_rate', SEARCH_SPACE['learning_rate']),
            'l2_reg': trial.suggest_categorical('l2_reg', SEARCH_SPACE['l2_reg'])
        }
        model = create_and_compile_model(**params)

        callbacks = [
            ModelCheckpoint(f'best_model_{dataset_name}.h5', save_best_only=True, monitor='val_loss', mode='min'),
            EarlyStopping(monitor='val_loss', patience=PATIENCE, mode='min'),

            ReduceLROnPlateau(monitor='val_loss', factor=0.5, patience=PATIENCE // 2, min_lr=1e-6)
        ]

        model.fit(
            loader_tr.load(),
            steps_per_epoch=loader_tr.steps_per_epoch,
            epochs=EPOCHS,
            callbacks=callbacks,
            validation_data=loader_val.load(),
            validation_steps=loader_val.steps_per_epoch,
            verbose=2
        )

        return model.evaluate(loader_val.load(), steps=loader_val.steps_per_epoch, verbose=0)[1]

    study = optuna.create_study(direction='maximize')
    study.optimize(objective, n_trials=40)  

    best_trial = study.best_trial
    best_params = best_trial.params

    print(f"Dataset: {dataset_name}")
    print(f"Best Hyperparameters: {best_params}")

    best_model = create_and_compile_model(**best_params)
    best_model.load_weights(f'best_model_{dataset_name}.h5')

    # Evaluate the best model on the test set
    loss, r2 = best_model.evaluate(loader_te.load(), steps=loader_te.steps_per_epoch, verbose=0)
    print(f"Test Loss: {loss:.4f}")
    print(f"Test R^2: {r2:.4f}")
    print()

if __name__ == "__main__":
    datasets = [QM9(), TUDataset('ENZYMES')]  # Example datasets

    for dataset in datasets:
        print(f'Graphs in the dataset: {len(dataset)}')
        loader_tr, loader_val, loader_te = preprocess_dataset(dataset)
        optimize_and_evaluate(loader_tr, loader_val, loader_te, dataset.name)
