    [num_samples, num_features] = size(train_data);
    params = initialize_gru(num_features, hidden_size, output_size);
    
    train_losses = zeros(num_epochs, 1);
    test_losses = zeros(num_epochs, 1);
    
    for epoch = 1:num_epochs
        % 打乱训练数据
        shuffle_idx = randperm(num_samples);
        train_data = train_data(shuffle_idx, :);
        train_labels = train_labels(shuffle_idx, :);
        
        % 批量训练
        for i = 1:batch_size:num_samples
            batch_end = min(i + batch_size - 1, num_samples);
            X_batch = train_data(i:batch_end, :);
            y_batch = train_labels(i:batch_end, :);
            
            % 前向传播
            [h, cache] = gru_forward(X_batch, params);
            y_pred = output_layer(h', params.Wo, params.bo);
            
            % 计算损失
            loss = mean((y_pred - y_batch).^2);
            
            % 反向传播
            dL_dy = 2 * (y_pred - y_batch) / size(y_batch, 1);
            [dL_dWo, dL_dbo] = output_layer_backward(dL_dy, h');
            dL_dh = dL_dy * params.Wo;
            dL_dx = gru_backward(dL_dh', cache);
            
            % 更新参数
            params = update_params(params, dL_dWo, dL_dbo, dL_dx, learning_rate);
        end
        
        % 计算训练集损失
        train_pred = predict(train_data, params);
        train_losses(epoch) = mean((train_pred - train_labels).^2);
        
        % 计算测试集损失
        test_pred = predict(test_data, params);
        test_losses(epoch) = mean((test_pred - test_labels).^2);
        
        fprintf('Epoch %d/%d - Train Loss: %.4f, Test Loss: %.4f\n', epoch, num_epochs, train_losses(epoch), test_losses(epoch));
    end
    
    trained_params = params;
end

function params = initialize_gru(input_size, hidden_size, output_size)
    % 初始化GRU参数
    params.Wz = randn(hidden_size, input_size + hidden_size) * 0.01;
    params.Wr = randn(hidden_size, input_size + hidden_size) * 0.01;
    params.Wh = randn(hidden_size, input_size + hidden_size) * 0.01;
    params.bz = zeros(hidden_size, 1);
    params.br = zeros(hidden_size, 1);
    params.bh = zeros(hidden_size, 1);
    params.Wo = randn(output_size, hidden_size) * 0.01;
    params.bo = zeros(output_size, 1);
end

function [h, cache] = gru_forward(X, params)
    [num_samples, ~] = size(X);
    hidden_size = size(params.Wz, 1);
    h = zeros(hidden_size, num_samples);
    cache = cell(1, num_samples);
    
    for t = 1:num_samples
        x = X(t, :)';
        h_prev = h(:, max(1, t-1));
        
        z = sigmoid(params.Wz * [x; h_prev] + params.bz);
        r = sigmoid(params.Wr * [x; h_prev] + params.br);
        h_candidate = tanh(params.Wh * [x; r .* h_prev] + params.bh);
        h(:, t) = (1 - z) .* h_prev + z .* h_candidate;
        
        cache{t} = struct('x', x, 'h_prev', h_prev, 'z', z, 'r', r, 'h_candidate', h_candidate);
    end
end

function dL_dx = gru_backward(dL_dh, cache)
    [hidden_size, num_samples] = size(dL_dh);
    dL_dx = zeros(num_samples, size(cache{1}.x, 1));
    
    dL_dWz = zeros(size(params.Wz));
    dL_dWr = zeros(size(params.Wr));
    dL_dWh = zeros(size(params.Wh));
    dL_dbz = zeros(size(params.bz));
    dL_dbr = zeros(size(params.br));
    dL_dbh = zeros(size(params.bh));
    
    dL_dh_next = zeros(hidden_size, 1);
    
    for t = num_samples:-1:1
        dL_dh_t = dL_dh(:, t) + dL_dh_next;
        
        c = cache{t};
        dL_dz = dL_dh_t .* (c.h_candidate - c.h_prev);
        dL_dh_candidate = dL_dh_t .* c.z;
        dL_dr = (params.Wh' * dL_dh_candidate) .* c.h_prev;
        
        dL_dWz = dL_dWz + dL_dz * [c.x; c.h_prev]';
        dL_dWr = dL_dWr + dL_dr * [c.x; c.h_prev]';
        dL_dWh = dL_dWh + dL_dh_candidate * [c.x; c.r .* c.h_prev]';
        
        dL_dbz = dL_dbz + dL_dz;
        dL_dbr = dL_dbr + dL_dr;
        dL_dbh = dL_dbh + dL_dh_candidate;
        
        dL_dx_t = params.Wz(:, 1:size(c.x, 1))' * dL_dz + ...
                  params.Wr(:, 1:size(c.x, 1))' * dL_dr + ...
                  params.Wh(:, 1:size(c.x, 1))' * dL_dh_candidate;
        
        dL_dx(t, :) = dL_dx_t';
        
        dL_dh_next = params.Wz(:, size(c.x, 1)+1:end)' * dL_dz + ...
                     params.Wr(:, size(c.x, 1)+1:end)' * dL_dr + ...
                     params.Wh(:, size(c.x, 1)+1:end)' * (dL_dh_candidate .* c.r) + ...
                     dL_dh_t .* (1 - c.z);
    end
end

function [dL_dWo, dL_dbo] = output_layer_backward(dL_dy, h)
    dL_dWo = dL_dy' * h;
    dL_dbo = sum(dL_dy, 1)';
end

function params = update_params(params, dL_dWo, dL_dbo, dL_dx, learning_rate)
    params.Wz = params.Wz - learning_rate * dL_dx.dL_dWz;
    params.Wr = params.Wr - learning_rate * dL_dx.dL_dWr;
    params.Wh = params.Wh - learning_rate * dL_dx.dL_dWh;
    params.bz = params.bz - learning_rate * dL_dx.dL_dbz;
    params.br = params.br - learning_rate * dL_dx.dL_dbr;
    params.bh = params.bh - learning_rate * dL_dx.dL_dbh;
    params.Wo = params.Wo - learning_rate * dL_dWo;
    params.bo = params.bo - learning_rate * dL_dbo;
end

function y_pred = predict(X, params)
    h = gru_forward(X, params);
    y_pred = output_layer(h', params.Wo, params.bo);
end

function y = sigmoid(x)
    y = 1 ./ (1 + exp(-x));
end

function y = output_layer(X, W, b)
    y = X * W' + b';
end一个 GRU 层作为特征提取器，其输出将用于后续的模型，而不是直接输出预测结果。修改代码以满足这个要求 测试集呢？，并且需要的是用于回归", 'I am using pytorch, and I need to know if there is a way to constrain the value of the weights in a neural network to discrete values, such as only values between 0 and 0.9 that are evenly divisible by 0.5.  It there a way to modify the optimizer to enforce this type of constraint   ?']

      model.load_state_dict(state_dict)
  
  if isinstance(device, list):
      model = nn.DataParallel(model, device_ids=device)
  model = model.to(device)
  return model, config

def run_folder(model, args, config, device, verbose=False):
  start_time = time.time()
  model.eval()
  all_mixtures_path = glob.glob(args.input_folder + '/*.*')
  all_mixtures_path.sort()
  print('Total files found: {}'.format(len(all_mixtures_path)))

  instruments = config.training.instruments
  if config.training.target_instrument is not None:
      instruments = [config.training.target_instrument]

  if not os.path.isdir(args.store_dir):
      os.mkdir(args.store_dir)

  if not verbose:
      all_mixtures_path = tqdm(all_mixtures_path, desc="Total progress")

  detailed_pbar = not args.disable_detailed_pbar

  for path in all_mixtures_path:
      print("Starting processing track: ", path)
      if not verbose:
          all_mixtures_path.set_postfix({'track': os.path.basename(path)})
      try:
          mix, sr = librosa.load(path, sr=44100, mono=False)
      except Exception as e:
          print('Can read track: {}'.format(path))
          print('Error message: {}'.format(str(e)))
          continue

      if len(mix.shape) == 1:
          mix = np.stack([mix, mix], axis=0)

      mix_orig = mix.copy()
      if 'normalize' in config.inference and config.inference['normalize'] is True:
          mono = mix.mean(0)
          mean = mono.mean()
          std = mono.std()
          mix = (mix - mean) / std

      mixture = torch.tensor(mix, dtype=torch.float32)
      if args.model_type == 'htdemucs':
          res = demix_track_demucs(config, model, mixture, device, pbar=detailed_pbar)
      else:
          res = demix_track(config, model, mixture, device, pbar=detailed_pbar)

      for instr in instruments:
          estimates = res[instr].T
          if 'normalize' in config.inference and config.inference['normalize'] is True:
              estimates = estimates * std + mean
          file_name, _ = os.path.splitext(os.path.basename(path))
          output_file = os.path.join(args.store_dir, f"{file_name}_{instr}.wav")
          sf.write(output_file, estimates, sr, subtype='FLOAT')

      if 'vocals' in instruments and args.extract_instrumental:
          file_name, _ = os.path.splitext(os.path.basename(path))
          instrum_file_name = os.path.join(args.store_dir, f"{file_name}_instrumental.wav")
          estimates = res['vocals'].T
          if 'normalize' in config.inference and config.inference['normalize'] is True:
              estimates = estimates * std + mean
          sf.write(instrum_file_name, mix_orig.T - estimates, sr, subtype='FLOAT')

  print("Elapsed time: {:.2f} sec".format(time.time() - start_time))

def proc_folder(args):
  parser = argparse.ArgumentParser()
  parser.add_argument("--model_type", type=str, default='mdx23c', 
                      help="One of bandit, bandit_v2, bs_roformer, htdemucs, mdx23c, mel_band_roformer, scnet, scnet_unofficial, segm_models, swin_upernet, torchseg")
  parser.add_argument("--config_path", type=str, help="path to config file")
  parser.add_argument("--start_check_point", type=str, default='', help="Initial checkpoint to valid weights")
  parser.add_argument("--input_folder", type=str, help="folder with mixtures to process")
  parser.add_argument("--store_dir", default="", type=str, help="path to store results as wav file")
  parser.add_argument("--device_ids", nargs='+', type=int, default=0, help='list of gpu ids')
  parser.add_argument("--extract_instrumental", action='store_true', help="invert vocals to get instrumental if provided")
  parser.add_argument("--disable_detailed_pbar", action='store_true', help="disable detailed progress bar")
  parser.add_argument("--force_cpu", action='store_true', help="Force the use of CPU even if CUDA is available")
  
  if args is None:
      args = parser.parse_args()
  else:
      args = parser.parse_args(args)

  device = "cpu"
  if args.force_cpu:
      device = "cpu"
  elif torch.cuda.is_available():
      print('CUDA is available, use --force_cpu to disable it.')
      device = f'cuda:{args.device_ids}' if isinstance(args.device_ids, int) else f'cuda:{args.device_ids[0]}'
  elif torch.backends.mps.is_available():
      device = "mps"

  print("Using device: ", device)

  model_load_start_time = time.time()
  torch.backends.cudnn.benchmark = True

  model, config = load_model(args.model_type, args.config_path, args.start_check_point, device)
  print("Instruments: {}".format(config.training.instruments))
  
  print("Model load time: {:.2f} sec".format(time.time() - model_load_start_time))

  run_folder(model, args, config, device, verbose=True)

if __name__ == "__main__":
  proc_folder(None)
```

1.py:

```python
import argparse
import time
import librosa
import torch
import os
import numpy as np
import soundfile as sf
import torch.nn as nn
from utils import demix_track, demix_track_demucs, get_model_from_config
import warnings
import sys
from models import uvr
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")

def load_model(model_type, config_path, checkpoint_path, num_overlap):
    model, config = get_model_from_config(model_type, config_path)
    
    config.inference.num_overlap = num_overlap

    if checkpoint_path:
        state_dict = torch.load(checkpoint_path, map_location='cpu')
        if model_type == 'htdemucs' and 'state' in state_dict:
            state_dict = state_dict['state']
        model.load_state_dict(state_dict)

    device = torch.device('cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu')
    model = model.to(device)
    return model, config, device

def run_files(model, files, args, config, device, verbose=False):
    start_time = time.time()
    model.eval()

    instruments = config.training.instruments
    if config.training.target_instrument is not None:
        instruments = [config.training.target_instrument]

    for path in files:
        try:
            mix, sr = librosa.load(path, sr=44100, mono=False)
            mix = mix.T
        except Exception:
            continue

        if mix.ndim == 1:
            mix = np.stack([mix, mix], axis=-1)

        mixture = torch.tensor(mix.T, dtype=torch.float32).to(device)
        if args.type == 'htdemucs':
            res = demix_track_demucs(config, model, mixture, device)
        else:
            res = demix_track(config, model, mixture, device)

        for instr in instruments:
            output_filename = f"{args.output}/{os.path.splitext(os.path.basename(path))[0]}_{instr}.wav"
            
            if isinstance(res[instr], torch.Tensor):
                result_data = res[instr].detach().cpu().numpy().T
            else:
                result_data = res[instr].T

            sf.write(output_filename, result_data, sr, subtype='PCM_16')

            if 'vocals' in instruments and args.extract_instrumental:
                instrumental_file = f"{args.output}/{os.path.splitext(os.path.basename(path))[0]}_instrumental.wav"
                
                if isinstance(res['vocals'], torch.Tensor):
                    instrumental_data = (mix - res['vocals'].detach().cpu().numpy().T)
                else:
                    instrumental_data = mix - res['vocals'].T

                sf.write(instrumental_file, instrumental_data, sr, subtype='PCM_16')

def run_inference(model, config, device, input_file, output_dir, model_type, num_overlap, extract_instrumental=False):
    args = argparse.Namespace(
        type=model_type,
        model=config,
        checkpoint='',
        input=[input_file],
        output=output_dir,
        extract_instrumental=extract_instrumental,
        num_overlap=num_overlap
    )
    run_files(model, args.input, args, config, device, verbose=False)

def proc_files(args):
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="Process audio files for instrument separation")
    parser.add_argument("--type", type=str, default='mdx23c', help="Model type (e.g., 'mdx23c', 'htdemucs', 'uvr')")
    parser.add_argument("--model", type=str, help="Path to model config yaml file")
    parser.add_argument("--checkpoint", type=str, default='', help="Path to model checkpoint file")
    parser.add_argument("--input", type=str, nargs='+', help="Audio files to process")
    parser.add_argument("--output", type=str, help="Directory to store the processed results")
    parser.add_argument("--extract_instrumental", action='store_true', help="Extract instrumental by inverting vocals")
    parser.add_argument("--num_overlap", type=int, default=1, help="Number of overlaps for inference")
    
    if args is None:
        args = parser.parse_args()
    else:
        args = parser.parse_args(args)

    if args.type == 'uvr':
        # Modifica os argumentos do sistema para o uvr.py
        sys.argv = [
            'uvr.py',  # Nome do script
            '--device_ids', str(0),  # Use -1 ou o valor desejado
            '--checkpoints', args.checkpoint,
            '--input', *args.input,
            '--batchsize', str(1),  # Use 1 ou o valor desejado
            '--cropsize', str(256),  # Use 256 ou o valor desejado
            '--model', args.model,
            '--output', args.output
        ]
        uvr.main()  # Chama a função principal do script uvr.py
        return

    torch.backends.cudnn.benchmark = True

    model, config, device = load_model(args.type, args.model, args.checkpoint, args.num_overlap)
    for input_file in args.input:
        run_inference(model, config, device, input_file, args.output, args.type, args.num_overlap, args.extract_instrumental)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    proc_files(None)

* Write M as an indexed tuple. For example, M = 6789 has four digits and we write out the tuple m_0 = 6, m_1 = 7, m_2=8, m_3 = 9. Note that if M has c digits then indices go from 0 to c-1 inclusive
* Write N as an indexed tuple, n_0 = .... Once again note that if N has d digits, indices go from 0 to d-1 inclusive
* Compute all products m_i*n_j where the sum of the indices i+j is 0. Add all the results. Note that the products and sum must be written down as separate steps.
* Repeat the previous step for i+j = 1, then for i+j = 2, etc., until we reach i+j = c + d - 2, inclusive.
* Now we compute the final result as follows. Begin a running tally with the result of the sum from the i+j = 0 computation.
* Repeat the following iteration for each of the remaining i+j cases in turn: Step 1: Multiply the running tally by 10 (by appending a single zero), Step 2: Add the sum from the next i+j case under consideration. Note that the multiplication by 10 must be written down as a separate step to the addition.

The final running tally is the product of the two numbers.

['import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

def plot_lineplot(data):
    plt.figure(figsize=(14, 8))
    ax = sns.lineplot(x='year', y='npp', hue='land_use', data=data, palette=['green', 'olive'], marker='o', errorbar=None)

    # 从数据中获取唯一的年份值作为 x 轴刻度
    unique_years = data['year'].unique()
    plt.xticks(unique_years)

    plt.title('NPP Changes for Grassland and Shrub Encroached Grassland Over Years')
    plt.xlabel('Year')
    plt.ylabel('NPP')
    plt.legend(title='Land Use Type', labels=['Grassland', 'SEG'])

    # 为每个数据点添加数值标签
    for line in ax.lines:
        xs = line.get_xydata()[:,0]
        ys = line.get_xydata()[:,1]
        for x, y in zip(xs, ys):
            label = f"{y:.2f}"  # 控制小数点后的位数
            ax.annotate(label, (x, y), xytext=(5, 5), textcoords="offset points")

    plt.show()

# 读取处理后的数据

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from matplotlib.font_manager import FontProperties

# 设置字体，确保支持中文字符
font_path = 'C:/Windows/Fonts/simhei.ttf'  # 这是 Windows 系统中的黑体字体路径，你可以根据需要选择其他支持中文的字体
font_prop = FontProperties(fname=font_path)

# 读取CSV文件
inpath = 'D:/DATA/JUH_seg/Excel/aver/JHU_seg_35_AD.csv'
data = pd.read_csv(inpath)
a = data.values.tolist()

n = len(a)
print(n)

# 初始化变量
attribute_number = 3
X_list = []
Y_list = []
Z_list = []

jrc = 1 / 4
buchang = [1, 2, 5, 10]

# 存储结果以便绘图
results = {
    'X': {buc: [] for buc in buchang},
    'Y': {buc: [] for buc in buchang},
    'Z': {buc: [] for buc in buchang}
}

# 主循环
for buc in buchang:
    jlrc = 0.5 * buc
    for dk in range(1, 4):
        daik = dk * buc
        for t in range(n):
            for s in range(t + 1, n):
                row_data = []
                x1 = a[t][0]
                y1 = a[t][1]
                z1 = a[t][2]
                x2 = a[s][0]
                y2 = a[s][1]
                z2 = a[s][2]

                X = x2 - x1
                Y = y2 - y1
                Z = z2 - z1
                distance = math.sqrt(math.pow(X, 2) + math.pow(Y, 2) + math.pow(Z, 2))

                row_data = [distance, X, Y, Z, a[t][attribute_number], a[s][attribute_number]]
                x_angle = math.acos(X / distance)
                y_angle = math.acos(Y / distance)
                z_angle = math.acos(Z / distance)
                if x_angle <= (math.pi * jrc) or x_angle >= (math.pi * (1 - jrc)):
                    point_x_distance = math.sqrt(math.pow(Y, 2) + math.pow(Z, 2))
                    if point_x_distance <= daik:
                        X_list.append(row_data)
                elif y_angle <= (math.pi * jrc) or y_angle >= (math.pi * (1 - jrc)):
                    point_y_distance = math.sqrt(math.pow(X, 2) + math.pow(Z, 2))
                    if point_y_distance <= daik:
                        Y_list.append(row_data)
                elif z_angle <= (math.pi * jrc) or z_angle >= (math.pi * (1 - jrc)):
                    point_z_distance = math.sqrt(math.pow(X, 2) + math.pow(Y, 2))

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def calculate_distances_and_differences(x, y, z, attributes):
    num_points = len(x)
    distances = []
    attribute_differences = []

    for i in range(num_points):
        for j in range(i + 1, num_points):
            distance = np.array([x[j] - x[i], y[j] - y[i], z[j] - z[i]])
            attribute_difference = attributes[j] - attributes[i]
            distances.append(distance)
            attribute_differences.append(attribute_difference)

    return np.array(distances), np.array(attribute_differences)

def calculate_semivariance(distances, attribute_differences, lag_size):
    max_distance = np.max(np.linalg.norm(distances, axis=1))
    num_lags = int(np.ceil(max_distance / lag_size)) + 1
    lags = np.arange(0, num_lags * lag_size, lag_size)
    semivariogram = np.zeros((num_lags, 3))

    for lag in range(num_lags):
        mask = (np.linalg.norm(distances, axis=1) >= lag * lag_size) & (np.linalg.norm(distances, axis=1) < (lag + 1) * lag_size)
        distances_in_bin = distances[mask]
        attribute_differences_in_bin = attribute_differences[mask]

        if distances_in_bin.size > 0:
            semivariogram[lag, :] = np.mean(attribute_differences_in_bin**2, axis=0)
        else:
            semivariogram[lag, :] = np.nan

    return lags, semivariogram

# 读取CSV文件
df = pd.read_csv('D:/DATA/JUH_seg/Excel/aver/JHU_seg_38_CN.csv')

# 提取三维坐标和属性值
x = df['X'].values
y = df['Y'].values
z = df['Z'].values
attributes = df['FA_Value'].values

# 计算点对距离和属性差
distances, attribute_differences = calculate_distances_and_differences(x, y, z, attributes)

# 计算半方差
lags, semivariogram = calculate_semivariance(distances, attribute_differences, lag_size=1)

# 绘制实验变异函数图
plt.figure(figsize=(14, 6))

plt.subplot(1, 3, 1)
plt.plot(lags, semivariogram[:, 0], marker='o', label='X direction')
plt.subplot(1, 3, 2)
plt.plot(lags, semivariogram[:, 1], marker='^', label='Y direction')
plt.subplot(1, 3, 3)
plt.plot(lags, semivariogram[:, 2], marker='s', label='Z direction')

for ax in plt.gcf().axes:
    ax.set_title('Experimental Variogram')
    ax.set_xlabel('Lag Distance')
    ax.set_ylabel('Semivariance')
    ax.legend()

plt.tight_layout()

import datetime
import math
import random

假设已经有了获取气象数据的方法 get_weather_data(date)
生成假数据的函数
def generate_fake_weather_data(start_date, num_days):
weather_data = []
for i in range(num_days):
date = start_date + datetime.timedelta(days=i)
wind_speed = round(random.uniform(0, 25), 1) # 随机生成风速，保留一位小数
rain = round(random.uniform(0, 50), 1) # 随机生成降雨量，保留一位小数
temperature = round(random.uniform(10, 30), 1) # 随机生成温度，保留一位小数
humidity = random.randint(30, 70) # 随机生成湿度
U = round(random.uniform(0, 100), 1) # 随机生成火险天气指数 U，保留一位小数


    # 构造每天的气象数据字典
    weather_data.append({
        "date": date.strftime("%Y-%m-%d"),
        "windSpeed": wind_speed,
        "rain": rain,
        "Temperature": temperature,
        "H": humidity,
        "U": U
    })

return weather_data
def calculate_m(m1, Ea, Ew, kd, kw):
# 根据条件判断使用哪个公式计算m
if m1 > Ea:
# 公式 A.1
m = Ea + (m1 - Ea) * (10 ** -kd)
elif m1 < Ew:
# 公式 A.2
m = Ew - (Ew - m1) * (10 ** -kw)
else:
# 公式 A.3
m = m1


return m
def calculate_m1(m0, r):
# 确保降雨量r和前一天的含水量mo是非负数
r, m0 = max(0, r), max(0, m0)


if r <= 0.5:
    # 公式 A.4
    m1 = m0
elif 0.5 < r and m0 <= 150:
    # 公式 A.5
    m1 = m0 + 42.5 * math.exp(-1.5 * (r - 0.5)) * (1 - math.exp(-6.93 * (r - 0.5)))
elif 0.5 < r and m0 > 150:
    # 公式 A.6 需要提供具体的公式内容
    term1 = 42.5 * math.exp(-100 / (251 - m0)) * (r - 0.5) * (1 - math.exp(-6.93 * (r - 0.5)))
    term2 = 0.0015 * (m0 - 250) ** 2 * (r - 0.5) ** 0.5
    m1 = m0 + term1 + term2
# else:

# 如果计算的m1大于250，则m1设为250
m1 = min(250, m1)

return m1
def calculate_m0(F0):
m0 = 147.2 * (101 - F0) / (59.5 + F0)
return m0

def calculate_Ed(H, T):
Ed = 0.942 * H ** 0.679 + (11 * H / (10 + H)) + 0.18 * (21.1 - T) * (1 - math.exp(-0.115 * H))
return Ed

def calculate_kd(H, W, T):
kd = 0.424 * (1 - (H / 100) ** 1.7) + 0.0694 * W ** 0.5 * (1 - (H / 100) ** 8) + 0.581 * math.exp(0.0365 * T)
return kd

def calculate_Ew(H, T):
Ew = 0.618 * H ** 0.753 + 10 * (H - 100) / (10 + H) + 0.18 * (21.1 - T) * (1 - math.exp(-0.115 * H))
return Ew

def calculate_kw(H, W, T):
kw = 0.424 * (1 - ((100 - H) / 100) ** 1.7) + 0.0694 * W ** 0.5 * (1 - ((100 - H) / 100) ** 8) + 0.581 * math.exp(
0.0365 * T)
return kw

def calculate_R(W, m):
R = 0.208 * math.exp(0.05039 * W) * 91.9 * math.exp(-0.1368 * m) * ((1 - m ** 5.31) / 4.93e7)
return R

def calculate_humidity_index(m):
# 计算表层可燃物湿度指数 F
F = (59.5 * (250 - m)) / (147.2 + m)
return F

def calculate_m_score(weather_conditions, F0_yesterday):
if not isinstance(weather_conditions, dict):
raise TypeError("weather_conditions should be a dictionary")


W = weather_conditions.get('windSpeed', 0)
H = weather_conditions.get('H', 0)
T = weather_conditions.get('Temperature', 0)
r = weather_conditions.get('rain', 0)

m0 = calculate_m0(F0_yesterday)
m1 = calculate_m1(m0, r)
Ed = calculate_Ed(H, T)
kd = calculate_kd(H, W, T)
Ew = calculate_Ew(H, T)
kw = calculate_kw(H, W, T)
m = calculate_m(m1, Ed, Ew, kd, kw)

return m
def calculate_R_score(weather_conditions, F0_yesterday):
if not isinstance(weather_conditions, dict):
raise TypeError("weather_conditions should be a dictionary")


W = weather_conditions.get('windSpeed', 0)
H = weather_conditions.get('H', 0)
T = weather_conditions.get('Temperature', 0)

m1 = calculate_m1(m0, r)
Ed = calculate_Ed(H, T)
kd = calculate_kd(H, W, T)
Ew = calculate_Ew(H, T)
kw = calculate_kw(H, W, T)
m = calculate_m(m1, Ed, Ew, kd, kw)
R = calculate_R(W, m)

return R
def calculate_F_score(weather_conditions, F0_yesterday):
if not isinstance(weather_conditions, dict):
raise TypeError("weather_conditions should be a dictionary")


W = weather_conditions.get('windSpeed', 0)
H = weather_conditions.get('H', 0)

kw = calculate_kw(H, W, T)

F = calculate_humidity_index(m)

return F
def calculate_fire_weather_index(weather_conditions, F0_yesterday, U):
R = calculate_R_score(weather_conditions, F0_yesterday)
def calculate_f_D(U):
if U <= 80:
return 0.626 * U**0.809 + 2
else:
return 1000 / (25 + 108.64 * math.exp(-0.023 * U))


def calculate_B(R, U):
    f_D = calculate_f_D(U)
    return 0.1 * R * f_D

def calculate_S(B):
    if B > 1:
        return math.exp(2.72 * (0.434 * math.log(B))**0.647)
    else:
        return B

B = calculate_B(R, U)

filtering capabilities based on product stock availability. It seamlessly 
integrates with the existing website_sale module to provide a more 
user-friendly and efficient shopping experience.

Key Features:
-------------
1. **Stock-based Filtering:** Allows customers to filter products based on their 
   current stock status, improving the shopping experience by showing only 
   available items.

2. **Real-time Stock Updates:** Implements a mechanism to update product stock 
   status in real-time, ensuring customers always see the most current 
   availability information.

3. **Performance Optimization:** Utilizes advanced caching mechanisms to minimize 
   database queries and improve page load times, especially for large product catalogs.

4. **Enhanced Product Visibility Control:** Provides administrators with more 
   granular control over which products are visible on the website based on 
   their stock status and publication settings.

5. **Customizable Stock Display:** Offers flexibility in how stock information is 
   displayed to customers, allowing for customization to fit specific business 
   needs.

6. **Variant-aware Stock Management:** Handles complex products with multiple 
   variants, accurately reflecting stock levels for each variant.

7. **SEO-friendly Implementation:** Ensures that stock-based filtering doesn't 
   negatively impact the website's search engine optimization.

8. **Mobile-responsive Design:** Fully compatible with mobile devices, ensuring 
   a consistent user experience across all platforms.

9. **Detailed Logging and Error Handling:** Provides comprehensive logging and 
   error handling mechanisms to facilitate easier debugging and maintenance.

10. **Caching and Cache Invalidation:** Enhances performance through effective 
    caching strategies and ensures data consistency with proper cache invalidation.

11. **Optimized Database Queries:** Uses efficient SQL joins and domain filtering 
    at the database level to improve the performance of product searches and filtering.

12. **User Experience Enhancements:** Implements AJAX for dynamic updates of 
    product listings without page reloads, improving the overall user experience.

Technical Features:
-------------------
- **Extends Core Odoo Models:** Extends core Odoo models (`product.template` 
  and `product.product`) to add stock-related fields and methods.
- **ORM Caching:** Implements ORM caching to optimize performance for stock calculations.
- **AJAX for Dynamic Updates:** Uses AJAX for dynamic updates of product listings 
  without page reloads.
- **Hooks for Customization:** Provides hooks for easy customization and extension 
  of functionality.
- **Detailed Logging:** Comprehensive logging for easier debugging and maintenance.
- **Cache Management:** Efficient cache management to ensure data consistency and 
  performance.

This module is ideal for e-commerce businesses looking to improve their 
online store's usability and customer satisfaction by providing more 
accurate and up-to-date product availability information.
    """,
}

import logging
from typing import Dict, Tuple
from odoo import http, tools, fields, models, api
from odoo.http import request
from odoo.addons.website_sale.controllers.main import WebsiteSale, TableCompute
from odoo.osv import expression
from werkzeug.exceptions import BadRequest
from werkzeug.wrappers import Response

_logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

class WebsiteSaleCustom(WebsiteSale):
    """
    This class extends the WebsiteSale controller to add functionalities
    related to filtering products based on stock availability.
    """

    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
        super().__init__(*args, **kwargs)
        _logger.info('WebsiteSaleCustom initialized')

    @http.route([
        '/shop',
        '/shop/page/<int:page>',
        '/shop/category/<model("product.public.category"):category>',
        '/shop/category/<model("product.public.category"):category>/page/<int:page>'
    ], type='http', auth='public', website=True, sitemap=WebsiteSale.sitemap_shop)
    def shop(self, page=0, category=None, search='', ppg=False, **post):
        """
        This method overrides the default shop method to include stock-based filtering.
        It retrieves products based on search, category, and attribute filters,
        considering only products with available stock.
        """
        _logger.info('Shop method called with URL: %s', request.httprequest.url)
        try:
            # Validate and sanitize input parameters
            page, ppg, ppr = self._validate_shop_params(page, ppg)
            search = self._sanitize_search_input(search)

            # Extract attribute filter values
            attrib_list = request.httprequest.args.getlist('attrib')
            attrib_values = [[int(x) for x in v.split("-")] for v in attrib_list if v]

            # Generate the search domain
            domain = self._get_search_domain(search, category, attrib_values)

            # Count total products matching the domain
            product_count = request.env['product.template'].sudo().search_count(domain)

            # Retrieve filtered products
            products = self._get_filtered_products(domain, product_count, page, ppg, attrib_values)

            # Prepare pager and product bins
            pager = request.website.pager(url='/shop', total=len(products), page=page, step=ppg, scope=7)
            bins = TableCompute().process(products, ppg, ppr)

            # Update the response context
            response = super().shop(page, category, search, ppg=ppg, **post)
            response.qcontext.update({
                'products': products,
                'bins': bins,
                'search_count': len(products),
                'pager': pager,
                'no_products_warning': 'No products available for the selected options.' if not products else False
            })

            return response

        except ValueError as e:
            # Handle invalid parameter errors
            _logger.error('Error validating parameters: %s', str(e), exc_info=True)
            return Response(f'Invalid parameters provided: {str(e)}', status=400, content_type='text/plain')
        except Exception as e:
            # Handle general exceptions
            _logger.error('Error in shop method: %s', str(e), exc_info=True)
            return Response(f'An error occurred while loading the shop page. Please try again later.', status=500, content_type='text/plain')

    def _validate_shop_params(self, page, ppg):
        """
        Validates and sanitizes the shop parameters (page and products per page).
        """
        try:
            page = max(0, int(page))
            ppg = max(1, min(int(ppg) if ppg else request.env['ir.config_parameter'].sudo().get_param('website.default_ppg', 20), 100))
            ppr = request.website.shop_ppr or 4
            return page, ppg, ppr
        except ValueError as e:
            raise BadRequest('Invalid shop parameters')

    def _sanitize_search_input(self, search):
        """
        Sanitizes the search input to prevent potential security issues.
        """
        sanitized = tools.ustr(search)[:100]
        return sanitized

    def _get_search_domain(self, search, category, attrib_values):
        """
        Generates the search domain based on search query, category, and attribute filters.
        Includes a stock-based filter to consider only products with available stock.
        """
        domain = super()._get_search_domain(search, category, attrib_values)
        website = request.website
        stock_domain = [('product_variant_ids.virtual_available', '>', 0)]
        domain = expression.AND([
            domain,
            [('website_published', '=', True)],
            [('website_id', 'in', (False, website.id))],
            stock_domain
        ])
        return domain

    def _get_filtered_products(self, domain, product_count, page, ppg, grouped_attribs):
        """
        Retrieves filtered products based on the search domain.
        Uses an optimized search method for large product sets.
        """
        if product_count > 5000:
            return self._search_and_filter_products(domain, ppg, page, grouped_attribs)
        else:
            products = request.env['product.template'].search(domain, limit=ppg, offset=page * ppg)
            if grouped_attribs:
                products = self._filter_products_by_attributes(products, grouped_attribs)
            return products

    def _filter_products_by_attributes(self, products, attrib_values):
        """
        Filters products based on selected attributes, considering stock availability for each variant.
        Optimized using set operations for efficient attribute matching.
        """
        ProductProduct = request.env['product.product']
        filtered_product_ids = set()

        # Convert attrib_values to a dictionary for easier lookup
        attrib_dict = {}
        for attr, value in attrib_values:
            if attr not in attrib_dict:
                attrib_dict[attr] = set()
            attrib_dict[attr].add(value)

        for product in products:
            variants = ProductProduct.sudo().search([('product_tmpl_id', '=', product.id)])
            for variant in variants:
                # Use set operations for efficient attribute matching
                variant_attr_values = set(variant.product_template_attribute_value_ids.mapped('product_attribute_value_id.id'))
                matches_all_attributes = all(variant_attr_values & attrib_dict[attr] for attr in attrib_dict)

                if matches_all_attributes and variant.virtual_available > 0:
                    filtered_product_ids.add(product.id)
                    break

        filtered_products = request.env['product.template'].sudo().browse(list(filtered_product_ids))
        return filtered_products

    @tools.ormcache('domain', 'fields_to_fetch', 'limit', 'offset')
    def _search_read_cached(self, domain, fields_to_fetch, limit, offset):
        """
        Cached method for searching and reading product data.
        """
        return request.env['product.template'].search_read(domain, fields=fields_to_fetch, limit=limit, offset=offset)

    def _search_and_filter_products(self, domain, ppg, page, grouped_attribs):
        """
        Optimized search and filtering method for large product sets.
        """
        ProductTemplate = request.env['product.template']
        offset = page * ppg

        domain = expression.AND([domain, request.website.get_current_website().website_domain()])

        fields_to_fetch = ['id', 'name', 'website_url']
        products = self._search_read_cached(domain, fields_to_fetch, ppg, offset)

        if grouped_attribs:
            products = [p for p in products if self._product_matches_attributes(p['id'], grouped_attribs)]

        return ProductTemplate.browse([p['id'] for p in products])

    def _product_matches_attributes(self, product_id, grouped_attribs):
        """
        Checks if a product matches the selected attributes, considering stock availability.
        """
        ProductProduct = request.env['product.product']
        variants = ProductProduct.sudo().search([('product_tmpl_id', '=', product_id)])

        for variant in variants:
            if variant.virtual_available > 0:
                variant_attr_values = set(variant.product_template_attribute_value_ids.mapped('product_attribute_value_id.id'))
                if all(any(val in variant_attr_values for val in value_ids) for value_ids in grouped_attribs.values()):
                    return True
        return False

    @api.model
    def _invalidate_cache(self):
        """
        Invalidates the cache for the `_search_read_cached` method.
        This method should be called whenever product availability or related data changes.
        """
        self._search_read_cached.clear_cache(self)

# Add signals and cron jobs for automatic cache invalidation

# Example signal handler for stock quantity changes
@api.model
def _product_qty_changed(self, records):
    self._invalidate_cache()

from odoo import api, models
class ProductProduct(models.Model):
    _inherit = 'product.product'

    @api.model
    def create(self, vals):
        res = super(ProductProduct, self).create(vals)
        if res:
            request.env['website_sale_custom'].sudo()._product_qty_changed(res)
        return res

    def write(self, vals):
        res = super(ProductProduct, self).write(vals)
        if res:
            request.env['website_sale_custom'].sudo()._product_qty_changed(self)
        return res

    def unlink(self):
        # Before deleting, trigger the signal
        if self:
            request.env['website_sale_custom'].sudo()._product_qty_changed(self)
        res = super(ProductProduct, self).unlink()
        return res

from odoo import models, fields, api
from odoo.tools import ormcache
import logging

_logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

class ProductTemplate(models.Model):
    """
    Extends the 'product.template' model to add a computed field for
    website available quantity and caching mechanisms for improved performance.
    """
    _inherit = 'product.template'

    website_available_qty = fields.Float(
        compute='_compute_website_available_qty',
        string='Website Available Quantity',
        help="Total available quantity for this product across all variants, considering website visibility.",
    )

    @api.depends('product_variant_ids.qty_available')
    def _compute_website_available_qty(self):
        """
        Computes the total available quantity for the product template by summing
        the quantities of its variants. Takes into account website visibility.
        This method is automatically triggered when the 'qty_available' field
        of any product variant changes.
        """
        for product in self:
            product.website_available_qty = sum(product.mapped('product_variant_ids.qty_available'))
            _logger.debug('Product ID: %s, Computed Website Available Qty: %s', product.id, product.website_available_qty)

    @ormcache('self.id')
    def _get_website_available_qty(self):
        """
        Cached method to get the website available quantity.
        Returns the sum of variant quantities for multi-variant products,
        otherwise returns the product's own quantity.
        Expects a single-record recordset.
        """
        if not self:
            _logger.warning("Called _get_website_available_qty with no records")
            return 0
        try:
            self.ensure_one()  # Ensure the method is called with a single record
        except ValueError:
            _logger.error("Called _get_website_available_qty with multiple records: %s", self.ids)
            raise ValueError("Method _get_website_available_qty expects a single-record recordset.")
        
        if self.product_variant_count > 1:
            return sum(self.product_variant_ids.mapped('qty_available'))
        else:
            return self.qty_available

    @api.model
    def clear_caches(self):
        """
        Clears the cache for the `_get_website_available_qty` method.
        Should be called whenever product quantities or related data changes.
        """
        ProductTemplate._get_website_available_qty.clear_cache(self)

    @api.model
    def create(self, vals):
        """
        Overrides the create method to clear caches after creating a new product template.
        Ensures that the cache remains consistent after a new product is added.
        """
        res = super(ProductTemplate, self).create(vals)
        self.clear_caches()
        return res

    def write(self, vals):
        """
        Overrides the write method to clear caches after updating a product template.
        Ensures that the cache remains consistent after any changes to the product.
        """
        res = super(ProductTemplate, self).write(vals)
        self.clear_caches()
        return res

    def unlink(self):
        """
        Overrides the unlink method to clear caches after deleting a product template.
        Ensures that the cache remains consistent after a product is removed.
        """
        res = super(ProductTemplate, self).unlink()
        self.clear_caches()
        return res


class ProductProduct(models.Model):
    """
    Extends the 'product.product' model to add computed fields for
    stock status and website availability, along with caching mechanisms.
    """
    _inherit = 'product.product'

    is_in_stock = fields.Boolean(
        compute='_compute_is_in_stock',
        string='Is In Stock',
        help="Indicates whether the product is currently in stock.",
    )

    @api.depends('qty_available')
    def _compute_is_in_stock(self):
        """
        Computes the 'is_in_stock' field based on the product's available quantity.
        This method is automatically triggered when the 'qty_available' field changes.
        """
        for product in self:
            product.is_in_stock = product._get_is_in_stock()
            _logger.debug('Product ID: %s, Is In Stock: %s', product.id, product.is_in_stock)

    @ormcache('self.id')
    def _get_is_in_stock(self):
        """
        Cached method to determine if the product is in stock.
        Expects a single-record recordset.
        """
        if not self:
            _logger.warning("Called _get_is_in_stock with no records")
            return False
        try:
            self.ensure_one()  # Ensure the method is called with a single record
        except ValueError:
            _logger.error("Called _get_is_in_stock with multiple records: %s", self.ids)
            raise ValueError("Method _get_is_in_stock expects a single-record recordset.")
        
        return self.qty_available > 0

    @ormcache('self.id')
    def is_available_for_website(self):
        """
        Cached method to check if the product is available for display on the website.
        Considers website publication status, stock availability, and out-of-stock order settings.
        Expects a single-record recordset.
        """
        if not self:
            _logger.warning("Called is_available_for_website with no records")
            return False
        try:
            self.ensure_one()  # Ensure the method is called with a single record
        except ValueError:
            _logger.error("Called is_available_for_website with multiple records: %s", self.ids)
            raise ValueError("Method is_available_for_website expects a single-record recordset.")
        
        available = self.website_published and self.product_tmpl_id.website_published and (self.is_in_stock or self.allow_out_of_stock_order)
        _logger.debug('Product ID: %s, Available for Website: %s', self.id, available)
        return available

    @api.model
    def clear_caches(self):
        """
        Clears the caches for the `_get_is_in_stock` and `is_available_for_website` methods.
        Should be called whenever product stock or related data changes.
        """
        ProductProduct._get_is_in_stock.clear_cache(self)
        ProductProduct.is_available_for_website.clear_cache(self)

    @api.model
    def create(self, vals):
        """
        Overrides the create method to clear caches after creating a new product.
        Ensures that the cache remains consistent after a new product is added.
        """
        res = super(ProductProduct, self).create(vals)
        self.clear_caches()
        return res

    def write(self, vals):
        """
        Overrides the write method to clear caches after updating a product.
        Ensures that the cache remains consistent after any changes to the product.
        """
        res = super(ProductProduct, self).write(vals)
        self.clear_caches()
        return res

    def unlink(self):
        """
        Overrides the unlink method to clear caches after deleting a product.
        Ensures that the cache remains consistent after a product is removed.
        """
        res = super(ProductProduct, self).unlink()
        self.clear_caches()
        return res

    @api.model
    def _website_show_quick_add(self):
        """
        Always show the quick add button on the website.
        This method can be customized to add additional logic if needed.
        """
        return True
# end of custom_stock_check/models/product.py

console.log('Product Stock Status JS file loading...');

(function() {
    'use strict'; // Enforce stricter JavaScript parsing rules for better code quality

    /**
     * Initializes the ProductStockStatus widget.
     * This function is called when the DOM is ready and Odoo is available.
     * @returns {Promise} A promise that resolves when the widget is initialized.
     */
    function initProductStockStatus() {
        return new Promise((resolve) => {
            console.log("Initializing ProductStockStatus");

            // Check if Odoo and its define method are available
            if (typeof odoo !== 'undefined' && odoo.define) {
                // Define the widget within Odoo's module system
                odoo.define('website_sale.product_stock_status', function (require) {
                    console.log("Inside odoo.define for website_sale.product_stock_status");

                    // Try to load required dependencies
                    let publicWidget, core;
                    try {
                        publicWidget = require('web.public.widget');
                        console.log("web.public.widget loaded successfully");
                    } catch (error) {
                        console.error("Error loading web.public.widget:", error);
                    }

                    try {
                        core = require('web.core');
                        console.log("web.core loaded successfully");
                    } catch (error) {
                        console.error("Error loading web.core:", error);
                    }

                    // If dependencies are not available, resolve the promise and exit
                    if (!publicWidget || !core) {
                        console.error("Required dependencies not available. PublicWidget:", !!publicWidget, "Core:", !!core);
                        resolve();
                        return;
                    }

                    // Get the translation function from web.core
                    const _t = core._t;

                    /**
                     * The ProductStockStatus widget checks for visible products on the shop page
                     * and displays a "No products available" message if none are found.
                     */
                    const ProductStockStatus = publicWidget.Widget.extend({
                        selector: '.oe_website_sale', // Selector for the main website sale container

                        /**
                         * Called when the widget is started.
                         * Checks for visible products if on the product listing page.
                         */
                        start: function () {
                            console.log("ProductStockStatus widget starting");
                            if (this._isProductListingPage()) {
                                this._checkVisibleProducts();
                            }
                            return this._super.apply(this, arguments);
                        },

                        /**
                         * Checks if the current page is a product listing page.
                         * @returns {boolean} True if the current page is a product listing page, otherwise false.
                         */
                        _isProductListingPage: function() {
                            return window.location.pathname === '/shop' || 
                                   window.location.pathname.startsWith('/shop/page/') ||
                                   window.location.pathname.startsWith('/shop/category/');
                        },

                        /**
                         * Checks the number of visible products and displays a message if none are found.
                         */
                        _checkVisibleProducts: function () {
                            // Use a more robust selector based on a data attribute
                            const visibleProducts = this.el.querySelectorAll('.oe_product[data-product-id]:not([style*="display: none"])').length;
                            console.log("Number of visible products:", visibleProducts);

                            if (visibleProducts === 0) {
                                const productList = this.el.querySelector('#products_grid');
                                if (productList && !productList.querySelector('.no_products_message')) {
                                    const messageDiv = document.createElement('div');
                                    messageDiv.className = 'alert alert-info no_products_message';
                                    messageDiv.textContent = _t("No products available with the current filters.");
                                    productList.prepend(messageDiv);
                                }
                            } else {
                                const noProductsMessage = this.el.querySelector('.no_products_message');
                                if (noProductsMessage) {
                                    noProductsMessage.remove();
                                }
                            }
                        },
                    });

                    // Register the widget in Odoo's widget registry
                    publicWidget.registry.ProductStockStatus = ProductStockStatus;
                    console.log('ProductStockStatus widget registered');
                    resolve();
                });
            } else {
                console.warn('Odoo not found or odoo.define not available, ProductStockStatus widget not initialized');
                resolve();
            }
        });
    }

    /**
     * Waits for Odoo to be loaded before initializing the widget.
     * @param {number} maxWait The maximum time to wait in milliseconds.
     * @param {number} interval The interval between checks in milliseconds.
     * @returns {Promise} A promise that resolves when Odoo is loaded or rejects after a timeout.
     */
    function waitForOdoo(maxWait = 30000, interval = 100) {
        return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
            const startTime = Date.now();
            const checker = setInterval(() => {
                if (typeof odoo !== 'undefined' && odoo.define) {
                    clearInterval(checker);
                    resolve();
                } else if (Date.now() - startTime > maxWait) {
                    clearInterval(checker);
                    reject(new Error('Timeout waiting for Odoo'));
                }
            }, interval);
        });
    }

    // Initialize the widget when the DOM is ready
    if (document.readyState === 'loading') {
        document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', () => {
            waitForOdoo()
                .then(initProductStockStatus)
                .then(() => {
                    console.log('ProductStockStatus initialization complete');
                })
                .catch((error) => {
                    console.error('Error initializing ProductStockStatus:', error);
                });
        });
    } else {
        waitForOdoo()
            .then(initProductStockStatus)
            .then(() => {
                console.log('ProductStockStatus initialization complete');
            })
            .catch((error) => {
                console.error('Error initializing ProductStockStatus:', error);
            });
    }
})();

@app.on_event("startup")   
async def on_startup(dispatcher):
    
    await bot.delete_webhook()
    kb = location_keyboard()
    Path_Endpoint=""
    if RENDER_DEPLOY_HOOK_URL:
        webhook_uri = f"{RENDER_DEPLOY_HOOK_URL}/{Path_Endpoint}"

        await bot.send_message(chat_id=ADMIN_ID, text='Приступаю к работе', reply_markup=kb)
        #await bot.send_message(chat_id=LILIANA_CHAT_ID , text='Приступаю к работе', reply_markup=kb) 
        print(f"Webhook set to: {webhook_uri}")
        #scheduler.start()
         
    else:
        print("RENDER_DEPLOY_HOOK_URL is not set. Webhook not configured.")
    try:
        await bot.send_message(chat_id=TG_CHAT_ID, text='Начинаем...' , reply_markup=ReplyKeyboardRemove() )
    except  TelegramBadRequest as e:
        print(f"Error sending message: {e}")
    # Start the scheduler

#'latitude': 55.808198, 'longitude': 37.706709

@dp.message(Command("start"))
@dp.message(Command("location"))
async def handle_location(message: types.Message,state: FSMContext):
    kb = location_keyboard()
    on_place = f'<b>{message.from_user.username} на месте</b>'
    await message.answer(f"Запрос на показ геолокации  {on_place}", reply_markup=kb, parse_mode="html")
    await state.set_state(LocationState.username)
    username= message.from_user.username
    await  state.update_data(username=username)
    await state.set_state(LocationState.location) #my

@dp.message(OfficeCollectionState.waiting_for_clicks)
async def collect_office_click(message: types.Message, state: FSMContext):
    if message.text in OFFICES:
        # Access global storage instead of state
        global_data = await storage.get_data(chat=message.from_user.id)
        clicked_offices = global_data.get('clicked_offices', [])
        clicked_staff_in_offices = global_data.get('clicked_staff_in_offices', empty_offices)
       
        if message.text not in clicked_offices:
            clicked_offices.append(message.text)
            clicked_staff_in_offices[message.text].append(message.from_user.username)

            # Update global storage
            await storage.update_data(chat=message.from_user.id, data={
                'clicked_offices': clicked_offices,
                'clicked_staff_in_offices': clicked_staff_in_offices
            })

            await message.answer(f"You selected {message.text}")
            unclicked_offices = list(set(OFFICES) - set(clicked_offices))

            await send_final_report(unclicked_offices, clicked_staff_in_offices)
        else:
            await message.answer(f"You have already selected {message.text}")
    else:
        await message.answer("Invalid option")

async def send_final_report(unclicked_offices, clicked_staff_in_offices):
    await bot.send_message(
        TG_CHAT_ID,
        f"Не пропикались: {', '.join(unclicked_offices)}\n\n"
        f"Кто на каком пункте: {dict(clicked_staff_in_offices)}"
    )

@dp.message(OfficeCollectionState.waiting_for_clicks)
@dp.message(Command("kboard"))
async def start_collecting(message: types.Message, state: FSMContext):
    await state.set_state(OfficeCollectionState.waiting_for_clicks)
    # Initialize data in global storage when starting
    await storage.set_data(chat=message.from_user.id, data={
        'clicked_offices': [],
        'clicked_staff_in_offices': empty_offices
    })
    user_data = await state.get_data()
    net=user_data.get( 'choose_net',  "") 
    if not net : 
        net =OFFICES
    await message.answer(
        "Select the options:",
        #reply_markup= create_office_keyboard (net)## add net
        reply_markup= office_repl_builder(net)
    )

@dp.message(Command("start"))
@dp.message(F.text == "Выбрать пункт")
@dp.message(Command("net"))
async def choose_net(message: Message, state: FSMContext):
    await message.answer(text="Выберите ЯМ, Озон, ВБ...", reply_markup=row_keyboard(list_3nets))
    await state.set_state(OfficeCollectionState.choose_net)

@dp.message(Command("dice"))
async def send_dice(message: types.Message):
    arr= ['🎲', '🎯', '🏀', '⚽', '🎳',   '🎰']
    num_emoji=  randint(0, 5)
    
    await message.answer_dice(emoji=arr[num_emoji])
    #await bot.send_dice(TG_CHAT_ID, emoji=arr [(1+num_emoji)%5])
    await bot.send_dice(TG_CHAT_ID, emoji=types.dice.DiceEmoji.DICE)

@dp.message(OfficeCollectionState.choose_net, F.text.in_(list_3nets))
async def choose_net_office_after_net_chosen(message: Message, state: FSMContext):
    # Store the chosen network in the state data
    await state.update_data(chosen_net=message.text)
    # Get the list of offices for the chosen network

@dp.message(Command("start"))
@dp.message(Command("location"))
async def handle_location(message: types.Message,state: FSMContext):
    kb = location_keyboard()
    on_place = f'<b>{message.from_user.username} на месте</b>'
    await message.answer(f"Запрос на показ геолокации  {on_place}", reply_markup=kb, parse_mode="html")

    await state.set_state(LocationState.location) #my

@dp.message(OfficeCollectionState.waiting_for_clicks)
async def collect_office_click(message: types.Message, state: FSMContext):
    if message.text in OFFICES:
        # Access global storage instead of state
        global_data = await storage.get_data(chat=message.from_user.id)
        clicked_offices = global_data.get('clicked_offices', [])
        clicked_staff_in_offices = global_data.get('clicked_staff_in_offices', empty_offices)
       
        if message.text not in clicked_offices:
            clicked_offices.append(message.text)
            clicked_staff_in_offices[message.text].append(message.from_user.username)

            # Update global storage
            await storage.update_data(chat=message.from_user.id, data={
                'clicked_offices': clicked_offices,
                'clicked_staff_in_offices': clicked_staff_in_offices
            })

            await message.answer(f"You selected {message.text}")
            unclicked_offices = list(set(OFFICES) - set(clicked_offices))

            await send_final_report(unclicked_offices, clicked_staff_in_offices)
        else:
            await message.answer(f"You have already selected {message.text}")
    else:
        await message.answer("Invalid option")

async def send_final_report(unclicked_offices, clicked_staff_in_offices):
    await bot.send_message(
        TG_CHAT_ID,
        f"Не пропикались: {', '.join(unclicked_offices)}\n\n"
        f"Кто на каком пункте: {dict(clicked_staff_in_offices)}"
    )

async def start_collecting(message: types.Message, state: FSMContext):
    await state.set_state(OfficeCollectionState.waiting_for_clicks)
    # Initialize data in global storage when starting
    await storage.set_data(chat=message.from_user.id, data={
        'clicked_offices': [],
        'clicked_staff_in_offices': empty_offices

    user_data = await state.get_data()
    net=user_data.get( 'choose_net',  "") 
    if not net :

    await message.answer(
        "Select the options:",
        #reply_markup= create_office_keyboard (net)## add net
        reply_markup= office_repl_builder(net)
    )

@dp.message(OfficeCollectionState.waiting_for_clicks)
async def collect_office_click(message: types.Message, state: FSMContext):
    if message.text in OFFICES:
        # Access global storage instead of state
        global_data = await storage.get_data(chat=message.from_user.id)
        clicked_offices = global_data.get('clicked_offices', [])
        clicked_staff_in_offices = global_data.get('clicked_staff_in_offices', empty_offices)
       
        if message.text not in clicked_offices:
            clicked_offices.append(message.text)
            clicked_staff_in_offices[message.text].append(message.from_user.username)

            # Update global storage
            await storage.update_data(chat=message.from_user.id, data={
                'clicked_offices': clicked_offices,
                'clicked_staff_in_offices': clicked_staff_in_offices
            })

            await message.answer(f"You selected {message.text}")
            unclicked_offices = list(set(OFFICES) - set(clicked_offices))

            await send_final_report(unclicked_offices, clicked_staff_in_offices)
        else:
            await message.answer(f"You have already selected {message.text}")
    else:
        await message.answer("Invalid option")

 DB_HANDLING.py
 import json
import logging
import mysql.connector
from aiogram.fsm.storage.base import BaseStorage, StateType, StorageKey

class MySQLStorage(BaseStorage):
    def __init__(self, host, user, password, database, port):
        self.connection_params = {
            'host': host,
            'user': user,
            'password': password,
            'database': database,
            'port': port
        }
        self._create_table()

    def _create_table(self):
        try:
            connection = mysql.connector.connect(**self.connection_params)
            cursor = connection.cursor()
            cursor.execute("""
                CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS aiogram_storage (
                    user_id BIGINT,
                    chat_id BIGINT,
                    state VARCHAR(255),
                    data JSON,
                    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, chat_id)
                )
            """)
            connection.commit()
            cursor.close()
            connection.close()
        except mysql.connector.Error as err:
            logging.error(f"Error creating table: {err}")

    async def close(self):
        pass

    async def wait_closed(self):
        pass

    async def get_state(self, key: StorageKey) -> StateType | None:
        connection = mysql.connector.connect(**self.connection_params)
        cursor = connection.cursor()
        try:
            cursor.execute(
                "SELECT state FROM aiogram_storage WHERE user_id = %s AND chat_id = %s",
                (key.user_id, key.chat_id)
            )
            result = cursor.fetchone()
            return result[0] if result else None
        finally:
            cursor.close()
            connection.close()

    async def set_state(self, key: StorageKey, state: StateType = None):
        state_str = state.state if state else None
        connection = mysql.connector.connect(**self.connection_params)
        cursor = connection.cursor()
        try:
            cursor.execute(
                "INSERT INTO aiogram_storage (user_id, chat_id, state) VALUES (%s, %s, %s) "
                "ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE state = %s",
                (key.user_id, key.chat_id, state_str, state_str)
            )
            connection.commit()
        finally:
            cursor.close()
            connection.close()

    async def get_data(self, key: StorageKey) -> dict:
        connection = mysql.connector.connect(**self.connection_params)
        cursor = connection.cursor()
        try:
            cursor.execute(
                "SELECT data FROM aiogram_storage WHERE user_id = %s AND chat_id = %s",
                (key.user_id, key.chat_id)
            )
            result = cursor.fetchone()
            return json.loads(result[0]) if result and result[0] else {}
        finally:
            cursor.close()
            connection.close()

    async def set_data(self, key: StorageKey, data: dict):
        connection = mysql.connector.connect(**self.connection_params)
        cursor = connection.cursor()
        try:
            cursor.execute(
                "INSERT INTO aiogram_storage (user_id, chat_id, data) VALUES (%s, %s, %s) "
                "ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE data = %s",
                (key.user_id, key.chat_id, json.dumps(data), json.dumps(data))
            )
            connection.commit()
        finally:
            cursor.close()
            connection.close()

    async def update_data(self, key: StorageKey, data: dict):
        current_data = await self.get_data(key)
        current_data.update(data)
        await self.set_data(key, current_data)

    async def reset_state(self, key: StorageKey):
        await self.set_state(key, None)

    async def reset_data(self, key: StorageKey):
        await self.set_data(key, {})

    async def clear(self):
        connection = mysql.connector.connect(**self.connection_params)
        cursor = connection.cursor()
        try:
            cursor.execute("TRUNCATE TABLE aiogram_storage")
            connection.commit()
            print("Storage cleared")
        finally:
            cursor.close()
            connection.close()

@dp.message_handler(Command('report'))
async def send_report(message: types.Message):
    data = await storage.get_all_data()  # Assuming a method to fetch all user data
    all_clicked_offices = set()
    all_staff_in_offices = {}

    for user_data in data:
        for office, usernames in user_data['clicked_staff_in_offices'].items():
            if office not in all_staff_in_offices:
                all_staff_in_offices[office] = set()
            all_staff_in_offices[office].update(usernames)
            all_clicked_offices.add(office)

    unclicked_offices = list(set(OFFICES) - all_clicked_offices)
    report = f"Unclicked Offices: {', '.join(unclicked_offices)}\n"
    report += "Details per office:\n"
    for office, usernames in all_staff_in_offices.items():
        report += f"{office}: {', '.join(usernames)}\n"
    await bot.send_message(
                TG_CHAT_ID, report)

```
// main.go
package main

import (
	"context"
	"encoding/json"
	"log"
	"os"
	"os/signal"
	"syscall"

	"compare-app/internal/beloslutsev"
	"compare-app/internal/rabbitmq"
)

type InputMessage struct {
	PreOrderId       int    `json:"preOrderId"`
	EnquiryProductId int    `json:"enquiryProductId"`
	OriginalTitle    string `json:"originalTitle"`
}

type OutputMessage struct {
	PreOrderId       int                      `json:"preOrderId"`
	EnquiryProductId int                      `json:"enquiryProductId"`
	Result           beloslutsev.ReturnResult `json:"result"`
}

func main() {
	// Чтение переменных окружения
	rabbitmqUrl := os.Getenv("RABBITMQ_URL")
	inputQueue := os.Getenv("INPUT_QUEUE")
	outputQueue := os.Getenv("OUTPUT_QUEUE")

	if rabbitmqUrl == "" || inputQueue == "" || outputQueue == "" {
		log.Fatal("Missing required environment variables")
	}

	// Создание клиента RabbitMQ
	client, err := rabbitmq.NewClient(rabbitmqUrl)
	if err != nil {
		log.Fatalf("Failed to create RabbitMQ client: %v", err)
	}
	defer func() {
		if err := client.Close(); err != nil {
			log.Printf("Failed to close RabbitMQ client: %v", err)
		}
	}()

	// Создание очередей, если их не существует
	if err := client.DeclareQueues(inputQueue, outputQueue); err != nil {
		log.Fatalf("Failed to declare queues: %v", err)
	}

	// Слушаем входящую очередь
	msgs, err := client.Consume(inputQueue)
	if err != nil {
		log.Fatalf("Failed to consume messages from queue: %v", err)
	}

	ctx, stop := signal.NotifyContext(context.Background(), os.Interrupt, syscall.SIGTERM)
	defer stop()

	go func() {
		for msg := range msgs {
			if err := processMessage(msg.Body, client, outputQueue); err != nil {
				if err = msg.Nack(false, true); err != nil {
					log.Printf("Failed to negatively acknowledge message: %v", err)
				}
			} else {
				if err = msg.Ack(false); err != nil {
					log.Printf("Failed to acknowledge message: %v", err)
				}
			}
		}
	}()

	log.Println("Waiting for messages")
	<-ctx.Done()
	log.Println("Shutting down...")
}

func processMessage(message []byte, client *rabbitmq.Client, outputQueue string) error {
	log.Printf("Received a message: %s", message)

	// Декодирование JSON
	var inputMessage InputMessage
	if err := json.Unmarshal(message, &inputMessage); err != nil {
		log.Printf("Failed to unmarshal JSON: %v", err)
		return err
	}

	// Обработка сообщения
	outputMessage, err := json.Marshal(OutputMessage{
		PreOrderId:       inputMessage.PreOrderId,
		EnquiryProductId: inputMessage.EnquiryProductId,
		Result:           beloslutsev.Process(inputMessage.OriginalTitle),
	})
	if err != nil {
		log.Printf("Failed to marshal JSON: %v", err)
		return err
	}

	// Отправка результата в исходящую очередь
	if err = client.Publish(outputQueue, outputMessage); err != nil {
		log.Printf("Failed to publish a message: %v", err)
		return err
	}
	log.Printf("Successfully published a message: %s", outputMessage)
	return nil
}

var ctx = context.Background()

func readFromRedis(configRedis map[string]string, redisKey string) ([]string, error) {
	rdb := redis.NewClient(&redis.Options{
		Addr:     configRedis["host"] + ":" + configRedis["port"], //"localhost:46382",
		Password: configRedis["password"],
		DB:       0, // use default DB
	})

	return rdb.SMembers(ctx, redisKey).Result()

}

...

func Process(text string) ReturnResult {

	//================= инициализация ===============================================
	configRedis := map[string]string{
		"host":     os.Getenv("REDIS_HOST"),
		"port":     os.Getenv("REDIS_PORT"),
		"password": os.Getenv("REDIS_PASSWORD"),
	}

	redisKey := os.Getenv("REDIS_KEY")

    lines, err := readFromRedis(configRedis, redisKey) //readLines("Products.csv")//("Prod10.csv")//
	if err != nil {
		exitOnError(104)
	}
	if len(lines) == 0 {
		return printResults([]ProductResult{}, text, true)
	}

    return prepareResultList(lines, text)
}

This is my post: “This course has been an eye-opening journey into the complex workings of the brain and its impact on our behavior. While every topic offered valuable insights, some resonated with me more than others. Among all the knowledge gained throughout this course, neuroplasticity has been the most compelling for me. Learning about the brain’s remarkable ability to rewire itself and adapt in response to new experiences, learning new information, and even recover from injuries has been mind-blowing. All the knowledge on neuroplasticity we’ve gained is truly empowering, knowing that we can actively shape our brains throughout our lives highlights the importance of continuous learning and adaptability. This notion not only further fuels my curiosity about human behavior and mental processes but also instills a sense of hope and possibility for growth.

Learning about stress management techniques like biofeedback has equipped me with valuable tools for navigating the challenges of daily life. 
One final topic that was compelling to me was the biopsychology of psychiatric disorders. The insights gained from studying the brain mechanisms underlying conditions like anxiety and depression are invaluable. This knowledge can help in managing mental health in the workplace, promoting a more supportive environment for my employees who are dealing with such challenges. 
Participating in discussion boards throughout this course helped deepen my understanding of the material. I always enjoy the interactive nature of discussion boards. Engaging with my peers allows me to see different perspectives and applications of the topics we are learning, which helps with my own grasp of the concepts.
As we move on from this course, some things I know I won’t forget are the realization that the brain is an incredibly complex and dynamic organ, constantly shaping our thoughts, feelings, and actions. Also, my new understanding of how deeply interconnected our brain functions are with our everyday behavior and organizational dynamics. The practical applications of this knowledge, such as using biofeedback to manage stress or applying strategies to enhance learning and memory, are tools I can see myself using regularly. This insight has created a sense of amazement and respect for the complex functions of the human mind. 
The knowledge I've gained from this course will undoubtedly be beneficial to both my personal and professional settings. 
Good luck to everyone in their future endeavors!"

Understanding the different types of brain trauma, including concussions, traumatic brain injuries (TBIs), and their short-term and long-term effects, provided valuable insights into the vulnerability and resilience of the brain. The course covered the physiological processes that occur during and after a traumatic event, such as neural damage, inflammation, and the brain’s efforts to repair itself. This knowledge emphasized the critical importance of immediate and appropriate medical intervention, as well as the long-term care and rehabilitation necessary for recovery.
Similarly, the study of brain diseases, including neurodegenerative conditions like Alzheimer’s disease, Parkinson’s disease, and multiple sclerosis, highlighted the complexity of the brain’s functioning and the devastating impact these diseases can have on individuals and their families. The course explored the underlying pathological processes, such as the accumulation of amyloid plaques in Alzheimer’s disease or the loss of dopaminergic neurons in Parkinson’s disease, which contribute to the progression of these conditions. Understanding these mechanisms underscored the importance of early detection, research into therapeutic interventions, and the need for comprehensive care strategies.
